Don't search anywhere else, Bonnie will give you the best quality service you could ever find. She's conscientious and meticulous over details, and masters the waxing art like nobody else. She's so adorable and sweet I would just never want to go! I have a really, really good time each time. I'm french and I know that as soon as I am back in London, I will run to her, and I'm honest!

X
Bonnie is the most friendly person I've ever found here in London! Since my first wax i decided that she is PERFECT: quick and not painful!!!
Bonnie was very friendly and approachable. I went there for a wax which was thorough, quick and not painful beyond a typical waxing.
I have been going to Bonnie for nearly two years now. She is always extremely professional, friendly and offers an excellent service. Couldn't recommend her more !

I had an excellent experience at this clinic. From the moment I walked in, the space felt calm, modern, and immaculately clean, which immediately put me at ease. The consultation room was well-designed and private, with advanced equipment that made the whole process feel professional and reassuring.

The staff were extremely attentive and knowledgeable. They took the time to explain each step clearly, answered all my questions patiently, and tailored the treatment to my specific needs rather than rushing through a standard procedure. I never felt pressured, only well cared for.

Overall, this was a seamless and high-quality experience—from the environment to the technology to the service itself. I would highly recommend this clinic to anyone looking for professional, thoughtful, and trustworthy aesthetic care.

环境高级安静、设备专业、服务细致有耐心，是一次让人非常安心和值得信赖的体验。

Ann is honestly amazing. She’s very professional but also super easy to talk to, which makes the whole experience really comfortable. Before each session, she takes the time to check how my skin is doing and adjusts the treatment instead of just following a standard routine. She’s very honest about what’s worth doing now and what can wait, which makes her someone I genuinely trust. Highly recommend!

Had a positive experience with laser hair removal with Sania ✨

She is extremely attentive and kind - listened to all my concerns and made sure all are addressed. I have a sensitive skin, so always worried when trying to find a clinic. This one so far didn’t disappoint - clean and well maintained. Thank you!

I have had Hydrafacial a few times with Sania now. I could not recommend this place more. Their attention to detail, information and clinic are all great! During the treatment Sania was explaining everything to me which I found helpful as it’s always good to know how things work and how it benefits you. The reception team are very warm and friendly, I felt very welcome and to add to this the clinic is just beautiful. You truly feel relaxed and at home, my favourite feature is the stunning white light ceiling which makes you feel peaceful!

Thank you to the whole team and as I said I strongly recommend going here if you are looking for high quality treatment in a clean and beautifully designed clinic.

I recently had a photorejuvenation treatment at Derma Revive Medical Aesthetics Center, and I am absolutely thrilled with the results. From the moment I walked in, the staff made me feel welcomed and comfortable, providing a professional and warm environment. The specialist who handled my treatment was incredibly knowledgeable and took the time to explain the procedure thoroughly, addressing all my concerns with patience and care. The treatment itself was comfortable, and the results were visible almost immediately. My skin now looks radiant, with a noticeable reduction in fine lines and sunspots. I highly recommend Derma Revive to anyone looking for top-notch aesthetic treatments delivered by a team of caring professionals. Truly a five-star experience!

I had such a good experience at Fiore Aesthetics! I went in to get my lips done and also had IPL for my rosacea, and honestly, I’m so happy with the results. Flavio is amazing – super professional but also really kind and makes you feel completely comfortable. My lips look super natural (exactly what I wanted), and the redness in my skin has improved so much. The clinic has a really nice vibe too, very clean and calm. Totally recommend it!
I had a deep cleaning facial with Marina. She was very patient and took great care of my skin. She did an excellent job. Thank you, Marina 🫶🏻

I’ve been coming to Fiore Aesthetic in London for over a year now for Carboxy Therapy, and I can confidently say it’s one of the best decisions I’ve made for my skin.

Flavio is truly exceptional – he goes above and beyond for his clients, always making sure I feel comfortable, informed, and well taken care of. His attention to detail and genuine passion for what he does really shows in the results.

I also have to give a big shoutout to Carly at reception – she’s always so warm, friendly, and welcoming. From the moment you walk through the door, you feel at ease.

Highly recommend Fiore Aesthetic if you’re looking for expert care and a lovely experience from start to finish!

We had such an amazing experience with Flavio! My sister and I came to the UK for a trip interested in polynucleotides and Flavio took the time to do a virtual consult to explain the treatment before we even arrived. Knowing we were on a tight travel schedule, he actually came in on his day off to ensure we could have all the treatments done we were interested in, while still being close by should we have any concerns post treatment.  Both he and Carly made us feel right at home, and were so incredibly warm and welcoming. Additionally, Flavio addressed all of our concerns and is a masterful artist at his craft.  Thank you Flavio!! I wish I were closer to visit more often, and will definitely return when back in the UK!! ❤️❤️

I had an amazing experience with Flavio, from the moment you walk into his cozy, impeccably clean clinic, you feel at ease.
He’s incredibly knowledgeable and takes the time to explain everything in detail, making sure you fully understand before starting. Honestly, he spent more time making me feel comfortable than on the actual treatment, which speaks volumes about his care and professionalism.
I did carboxytherapy and an under-eye treatment, and the results are incredible! Much less pain than expected, just precision and expertise. I can’t wait for my next sessions because I’ll definitely be coming back! Highly recommend.

I recently had a laser treatment at Salon House, and it was fantastic! The salon is in a great location, impeccably clean, and the staff are incredibly friendly. The operator was professional and made me feel comfortable throughout the process. I'm thrilled with the results and highly recommend it for their excellent services. I'll definitely be back!
Great salon! Ersan did an amazing job with the cut and styling, super nice. Highly recommend!"

I went to this salon on March for a keratin treatment. When I washed my hair two days later, it was still very frizzy and looked like nothing had been done. I called back and they gave me another appointment, but during that visit they also did color and highlights right after the keratin. I later found out this should never be done.
By April, there was no trace of keratin left in my hair the waves and frizz had completely returned. Since then, I’ve been struggling with the damage caused to my hair. Every hairstylist I’ve visited since says it looks like no keratin was ever applied. Overall, a very disappointing experience.
Love coming here for a quick and fabulous blow dry!  Service is excellent and they’re all super friendly. Bonus: good products to buy for skin and hair available!

I had an amazing experience, for both  facial and haircut.
All the staff members were both friendly and very welcoming.
Left the salon with a big smile and feeling spoilt.
Thank you everyone

I had microneedling done with perfection clinic at the King’s Cross clinic and had such a great experience. It was completely pain free and was felt at the ease throughout. The information I received for aftercare was clear and I even had a face treatment with serums post microneedling. My skin feels amazing, thank you so much! Highly recommend going here.

I’ve been going to Skin Perfection for about 9 months now for laser hair removal and I’m really happy with the experience. The staff are always friendly and make you feel comfortable, and the place itself is clean and welcoming. I’ve already seen great results and would definitely recommend them to anyone thinking about starting treatment.

I’ve been going to Skinperfection for hair removal sessions and I’m really happy with the experience. From day one, the place has been  clean, hygienic, and very professional. The staff are always friendly and make you feel comfortable. Jade especially so positive, professional and really makes the whole process feel easy and relaxed. Plus, she’s such a lovely person. I’d definitely recommend Skinperfection with confidence.

Highly recommend! Today I had a steam facial and cholesterol spot removal and I swear it's taken a few years off of my face! Skin feels amazing, service was friendly and professional - I will definitely be going back for more treatments in the near future 😃

I had an excellent experience with Jade. She explained every step of my skin treatments clearly and made me feel completely comfortable throughout the process. The results look natural. Their professionalism, gentle approach, and genuine care truly stand out. Highly recommended!

I have never had such a deep and thorough facial cleansing experience ever in my life! This is my second visit, and I have just bought six more! The team is so welcoming,  professional and knowledgeable. Samira at the front desk is so helpful and funny, Carys the medical aesthican is such an expert and Daiva the patient consultant knows exactly what your skins needs!  I am so looking forward to my third visit!

I have seen Dr Elaine on two occasions for assessment and treatment and am delighted she is looking after my skin.  She is an extremely experienced dermatologist who is nothing but professional. At both appointments she took the time to listen and to explain everything. I recommend Dr Elaine without hesitation.

Super great experience at Eudelo today. I saw Dr Elaine for skin pigmentation and other issues. She really listened, asked about my concerns and my past treatments, and then did a thorough skin exam. You could tell she was genuinely invested in pinpointing the root cause of my issues and finding the right solution.
She recommended a detailed skincare routine that fits my skin, my schedule, and my budget. She showed me product options at different price points, let me try them on the spot, and never once pushed me to buy.
Above all, she was extremely generous with her time and explanations. I felt comfortable with her and I could sense that she’s not only knowledgeable but truly cares about helping me. Thank you, Dr Elaine!

I recently had the pleasure of having a facial at Eudelo, and it was an absolutely wonderful experience! The atmosphere was so calming and relaxing, making it easy to unwind and enjoy the treatment. Charolee was fantastic, her expertise and attention to detail made the whole experience even more amazing. My skin felt refreshed and rejuvenated afterward. I highly recommend Eudelo to anyone looking for a relaxing and effective skincare treatment!

I have been coming to Eudelo for facials over the past 8 months and really enjoyed the level and quality of care provided. In particular, I enjoyed facials with Holly as she has a very easygoing and warm personality as well as provides high-quality expert skin care. My facials have been relaxing, therapeutic, and restorative.

This branch is conveniently located within St Pancras Station, making it a very practical stop for commuters and travellers. It offers an extensive range of health-, beauty- and travel-essentials and a large pharmacy service. While the high traffic can make it feel busier than a typical high-street store, the extended hours and central location make it a reliable choice for quick stop-in visits.

Honestly such a good experience. I visited last Thursday. The store itself was great but the girl working there with the beautiful green eyes and brunette hair in the beauty department deserves a whole shout-out. I didn’t quite catch her name unfortunately ! She was super lovely and so welcoming, made me feel comfortable the whole time. You don’t get that kind of energy everywhere. Made the whole visit a lot better. Definitely coming back.
Busy store in st pancreas station, security at the entrance. Most of everyday and travel items available

I had such a lovely experience here! I came in looking for a foundation for my oily/combination skin, and Shaziya was so kind and helpful. She actually took the time to listen, made me laugh, and helped me find the perfect match Lancôme. She even gave me a free gift which was such a sweet surprise. Honestly, I left feeling really looked after  thank you for making my day! 💖

Amazing girl who was extremely helpful today I think her name is Niwi at Clarins station!many many thanks for your help .i was doubting about my choises but she took time to explain which products will work better for my skin type

Was recommended Hikari by a friend and I’m glad I booked in! Had a haircut with Ayumi, who was so lovely and a great hairdresser. She cut my hair exactly how I like and then gave it a beautiful blow wave. Was great to chat with and all the staff were so friendly (and for a fabulous price!). Thank you!
I don't often leave reviews but my experience at Hikari was great. My hairdresser, Ayumi, was very attentive and made suggestions based on how i regularly style my hair. Will definitely be returning.

I went to Hikari for the first time last week and Ash did an amazing job with my hair. She was so lovely and gave me advice on the cut. The blow dry was also excellent! I will definitely return. Thank you so much Ash!
My go to salon - Brandon always makes me feel 100x better than when I first step foot into the salon. The best 💗

Leona is an expert at hair, and it was a pleasure to have my haircut done by her. She took the time for a thorough consultation, gave me exactly the haircut I wanted, and offered personalised advice tailored to my hair type. On top of that, she was just a lovely person to talk to. I’ll definitely be coming back - thank you Leona!

I am writing this review as a warning to potential clients, particularly those seeking a technical colour service like Balayage. My experience with Daniele was deeply unsatisfactory, resulting in technical failure, hair damage.

I booked a Balayage, requesting a subtle, blended, and non-damaging colour transition. The service was a fundamental failure under the professional standard expected of a "Master Colourist."

1. Technical Failures and Misrepresentation:
• Result vs. Service: I paid for a Balayage (a smooth, blended, natural gradient), but received a result that was objectively a set of poorly executed Highlights. The result showed harsh, distinct bands of colour with no smooth transition (see attached photos).

• Initial Flaw: The first result was three distinct, unblended colour bands: my natural root, a harsh line of brassy orange, and then yellow. This is a technical error, not a "different technique."

• Inadequate Toning: The toner was left on for an insufficient time (approximately 5 minutes), resulting in persistent, unflattering yellow and brassy tones that Daniele later insisted were "perfect" and "how it is meant to be."

2. Hair Damage and Lack of Care:
• Despite being informed my hair was fragile, Daniele used 6% hydrogen peroxide and left the bleach on my hair for an excessive period of time (over 3 hours in total, with bleach fully saturated for over 50 minutes).

• This overly aggressive and prolonged processing constitutes a clear lack of reasonable care and resulted in my hair being damaged and burnt. When I questioned the process, his only response was to state he was a "professional."

3. Poor Customer Service and Refusal to
Rectify:

• After seeing the colour failure in natural light, I immediately returned. Daniele initially tried to dismiss the problem, stating there "wasn’t much he could do."

• I was misled about the salon’s closing time, told to come back after 6:00 PM (closing time is at 6pm) for a fix. I then had to wait an additional hour in the salon for him to address the issue.

• The final correction attempt was incomplete. He refused to lift the roots to the requested level or properly tone the ends.

• Refusal of Refund: After spending over 7 hours in the salon for a failed service and a failed fix, he refused a refund, maintaining the colour was "perfect."

I paid for a professional Balayage and received a technically faulty, damaging, and unacceptable service with the technique being that used for highlights (confirmed by a professional master colourist).

The salon has refused to provide the full refund that is warranted under my consumer rights for services not delivered with reasonable care and skill.

I strongly advise clients to look elsewhere for quality colour work.

(The first photo shows his first attempt, the remaining photos show my hair after the attempted fix)

Went to this salon 2 times already. Overall it’s an amazing space, but Daniele is making it perfect for me. Very calm, kind and listen carefully to what I’m saying, while also adding his professional input.
I highly recommend!

Alexandra always does an amazing job with my wavy/curly hair. I’m always amazed by how much texture she brings to it and the layers are perfect to accentuate my curls. The products they use in this salon always smell amazing which is a lovely bonus and it always has a relaxing atmosphere.

Rosa is absolutely amazing! She styled both my daughter's and my hair, and we couldn't be happier with the results. She was incredibly kind, professional, and made the entire experience enjoyable. Not only did she listen to what we wanted, but she also went above and beyond to make sure we left feeling confident and beautiful. If you're looking for a talented and friendly hairstylist, I highly recommend Rosa! We will definitely be coming back.

I really like the environment of the salon. It was chill and clean. Peter really did a great job. My hair looks bouncy and the haircut matches my expectations. Thank you Peter!! I will definitely come back again!!!

I had an exceptional and deeply relaxing massage with Andrea, he was so professional, polite and well-mannered.  I get a sport massage every fortnight but do have a lot of muscle tension and stiffness. I must say that of the hundreds of massages with different people I’ve had over the years, this must have been one of the very best. Truly! He also performed some stretches that no one has ever done during a massage. Truly 10/10!  I left feeling completely renewed, both physically and mentally. The atmosphere in the spa was serene and beautifully calming, creating the perfect space to unwind. The staff were warm, attentive, and welcoming throughout my visit. I highly recommend this spa to anyone seeking a truly restorative and uplifting experience.

We had a good moment at the spa, the massage was great. The pool was closed (apparently because of covid) but the sauna was open.
However, the process to book was hectic. First of all, you have to call to book, there is no website. And you do not get any kind of confirmation email. That would be fine in itself but once I booked, the spa called me back four or five times to make changes to my booking (both date and time, no possibility to get the massage at the same time for me and my friend, no pool available on the day etc).
Now maybe I just got a bit unlucky but it's a lot of changes to ask for.

I had booked this as a treat for my friends birthday and after reading the reviews I was starting to panic. I didn't want it to be a let down as it was meant to be a present. Surprisingly I had a really peaceful tranquil time. I had hot stone massage and a facial and they were done really well I can't fault the treatment at all. The facilities are small but there was no one else there except me. This is more of a 2/3 hour spa experience - maybe if the advertising reflected that it would get less complaints as facilities are small and you only have a gym, sauna and swimming pool. Slight things the spa could improve on- a nice warm greeting and explanation of where things are and what to do e.g you will have treatments first then use facilities after for an hour- please help yourself to water it is here etc. As it is small it is self explanatory but still it adds a nice touch as I did see other people  look around a bit lost like I did until you realised the plan. The water would give a more luxury feel if they used slices of lemon or cucumber and clear plastic cups rather than white insulated cups you would use in a cheap cafe. Also the resting area above the pool needs to be cleaned from underneath as the lack marks make it feel dirty. I've been to quite a few London spas
And for the money this was a nice experience and really not as bad as other reviews. Just a few tweaks and this spa would get a lot of great reviews

My friend and I came here using a voucher that we got from a third party. This voucher was for some treatments and afternoon tea.

The treatments were fine and the staff were nice and professional, but the afternoon tea was horrific. The value of this tea should have been about £30 per person but we waited for 45 minutes after arriving in the cafe (they also wanted our proof of purchase despite the spa having booked our slot for us) got a few disgusting finger sandwiches and some generic cakes. It was an absolute rip off.

The spa itself is very small but we didn't mind as we had it to ourselves. It is only really big enough for two people at a time.

Do not go there! Worst experience ever. I had booked it through Virgin Experience as a gift. I had to call so many times to book, ended up talking to someone very rude who literally hung up on me when I told her I just need a few second to think about the date. I asked for a confirmation email and never received one. When I showed up for my appointment I was told that the SPA WAS CLOSED. I am very disappointed and mad when they could have called me or send an email. So unprofessional, I will never go there again.

I had an incredible experience at White Room.
From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere felt calm, elegant, and truly luxurious. My therapist was extremely professional, gentle, and attentive — she explained every step clearly and customised the treatment based on my skin condition.

The facial left my skin glowing, hydrated, and noticeably firmer. I could see a difference immediately.
What impressed me most was the level of detail and the genuine care they give to each client.

If you’re looking for a high-end Swiss-style skincare experience in London, I can’t recommend White Room enough. I will definitely be coming back.

As a regular customer in Whit Room Beauty, I am confident to say it's my favourite place in London to have a facial treatment. And I will highly recommend anyone who is looking for a professional but also relaxing treatment. Not only does the White Room have amazing and professional staff, but it also the exclusive and solid collaborations with many luxurious beauty brands keeping it as a top-tier beauty spa in London.

I ordered some beauty products from White Room Beauty and I’m still amazed at how insanely fast they arrived — I genuinely didn’t think delivery could be that quick! Everything was perfect, beautifully packaged, and the free samples were such a lovely surprise. The service was truly outstanding and I’ll 100% be ordering from them again. Huge thanks to White Room Beauty for the exemplary service — you’ve gained a very happy, loyal customer!

Definitely  the best beauty salon in London! The  people there are amazing, make you feel very welcome. Especially their treatments work very well for me, my skin got so much better after each treatment.

I did the HydraFacial and the results were instant. My pores were much cleaner and my skin felt incredibly smooth. The therapist was gentle and explained everything clearly. It’s the perfect treatment if you want a fresh, glowing complexion.
Came in with my son looking for something to help his cold and flu. Was approached by a black girl who was sooo helpful and went above and beyond to make my experience better. Thank you so much

Tried to pay using self checkout. Got an error message which if I understood it correctly was caused by the machine being programmed to think a small bottle of cough medicine should weigh 750g (i.e. 3/4 of a kilo which is patently ridiculous). Security officer nearby ignored me and made no effort to help. Tried to pay at staffed checkout but all closed so forced to put my items down and leave. I’m not against self checkouts but please set them up properly and if you’re too greedy to provide sufficient staff to help customers when they go wrong don’t excessive lock down the functionality by, for example, enforcing weight verification.

Used this pharmacy multiple times over the last couple of months. The staff are really approachable, friendly and knowledgable. If they’re not sure about something, they don’t hesitate to double check. Brilliant service all round.
Really great pharmacy team. Friendly, knowledgeable and keen to do what they can to help you. The best pharmacy team I’ve ever come across in a Boots.

I had an amazing experience at this branch and would definitely recommend it to others. I was greeted by Anas who ordered the medication I needed in the morning and had my prescription filled by the early afternoon. I have changed my nomination to this pharmacy due to the experience I had. Wish all pharmacies were this efficient. Big thanks.

Super efficient (45 minutes of nail removal, reshaping and application) for a really affordable price. Amazing delivery of service and quality, super friendly staff. Love my nails and my friends love it too!

Second time I come here, they are all so friendly and kind. Since I moved to London from Spain I struggled a lot to find a nice hairdresser, everyone overcharged a lot and my last experiences they didn’t do a good job and I had to come back to them to fix it
Ricky is very good, you can see his concentration to make sure that your hair looks good , it’s amazing . Prices goood ! They are always giving you an smile and making you feel comfortable
I become a loyal customer :)

Horrible. The hairdresser lady didn’t understand my request and continued to do it then tried to cover her mistakes by a rough blow dry. I left with rough blow-dried hair and when it was damped I found that the upper layer was much shorter than the under layer, the whole haircut did not trim well. Not asymmetrical in the front and is supper cliffy on the side. Just take a look at the edges of the third pic, and tell me this is a salon quality. I’m in a super bad mood and today is Chinese new year I have to have dinner with friends on a horrible hair like this. Definitely not coming back again. If you want a short haircut, don’t come here, the hairdresser is unprofessional even less than amateur

Today Roberto did my highlights and I’m absolutely loving the end result. First time with Roberto so was a bit nervous as my hair is rather thin and can be damaged easily. Roberto was super professional and knew exactly what I needed. We agreed on fundamentals at the start and the result is perfect, exactly how I like it. Definitely coming back!!
Thank you Roberto x

Ricky is a true professional with remarkable patience and attention to detail. He takes the time to ensure every cut is just right before calling it finished. For those with thick, unruly hair, he's definitely the one to trust – highly recommend for anyone looking for a style that's both flattering and easy to manage. Thank you, Ricky!

Neville’s Hair & Beauty is the best salon I’ve ever been to. I have  been coming to the salon for  over 10 years. The stylists are exceptionally skilled, attentive, and consistently deliver flawless results—from high-fashion looks to beautiful everyday hair. The service is warm, professional, and reliable, and they care deeply about their work. Thanks to them, my hair is healthy, glossy, and I absolutely love it.

Afroditi is the only one person the world who truly knows how to blow-dry my hair properly—it’s thick and not easy to style.

Seniz is my favourite colourist for highlights—everyone constantly asks where I get my hair done and always compliments my hair.
I always highly recommend it to all my friends and people who asks me.

Irina ❤️

I absolutely love this place — my hair has never looked better. Keeping long, highlighted hair healthy and beautiful all year round isn’t easy, but with the care of Domenico and Afrodity, it has become the norm.

They truly understand my hair and look after it in the most incredible way. What’s especially important to me is that it doesn’t take so much time — I used to dread going to get my hair done, and now I genuinely look forward to it.

The atmosphere in the salon is wonderful, warm, and very professional. I highly recommend Neville Hair and Beauty for everything, from a simple blow-dry to a complete makeover

Neville’s Hair & Beauty is, quite simply, the best salon in the world. And I say that as someone who has been to many salons internationally.

I’ve been coming to Neville’s for over 15 years, and there’s a reason I’ve never gone anywhere else. They truly cover every base — from high-fashion, editorial-level hair (they work behind the scenes at fashion shows) to timeless, elegant everyday styling. Whatever you need, they deliver it flawlessly.

Every stylist is top-tier: incredibly skilled, intuitive, and genuinely attentive. They listen, they understand exactly what you want, and they execute with precision and care. The service is always impeccable — warm, professional, and consistent — and they are wonderfully reliable and accommodating when it comes to booking.

Neville’s looks after my mum’s hair, my family’s hair, and my friends’ hair — all with equally beautiful results. There’s a real sense that they care deeply about what they do, and that level of pride shows in the outcome every single time.

Thanks to them, my hair is now healthy, glossy, strong, and glowing again — and I absolutely love it.

A true institution. Unmatched expertise. Unrivalled service. I couldn’t recommend Neville’s more highly

only truly realised how exceptional Neville Hair and Beauty is once I moved to Dubai.
I now travel back to London every month just to do my colour and have a proper blow-dry — because no one does it like they do. The technical level, the attention to detail, and the understanding of hair are simply unmatched.
Beyond the results, the team has genuinely become a family. Everyone is inclusive, caring, and goes out of their way to help. This has meant even more to me recently, as living in Dubai and dealing with hard/dirty water caused me to lose almost half of my hair — and they supported me with expertise, honesty, and kindness at every step.
The cherry on top is Elena, the co-owner: Italian, incredibly knowledgeable, and far beyond a hair professional — she is a true luxury consultant who understands beauty, lifestyle, and confidence in a very rare way.
Neville is not just a salon. It’s a standard, an experience, and a place you trust with yourself.

I had an incredible experience at Neville’s Hair Salon! I booked in with Victoria for a balayage, and she absolutely exceeded my expectations. Not only is she talented and professional, but she’s also one of the nicest stylists I’ve met — so friendly, easy to talk to, and really made me feel at ease throughout the whole appointment.
She took the time to understand exactly what I wanted, offered helpful advice, and the end result was just *stunning*. My balayage looks natural, bright, and exactly how I hoped it would turn out (actually, even better!). I’ve had so many compliments already.
If you’re thinking about booking with Neville’s, definitely ask for Victoria — she’s amazing!

My name is Polina, and I would like to share my honest review of Ray Cochrane Academy.
I came to the academy with great enthusiasm, and the team did everything possible to make my learning experience both enjoyable and comfortable. The training was well- structured, supportive, and focused on building strong practical skills and confidence for working in the beauty industry.
From the very beginning, Stella and Amy were incredibly kind, professional, and supportive, always providing clear information and guidance throughout the course.
All the tutors are excellent, but my favourite was Pembe, the Level 2 & 3 tutor. She explains everything clearly, teaches with passion, and prepares her students to feel confident and ready to work after completing the course.

I genuinely recommend this academy and am very grateful for such a positive and inspiring experience.

I was super nervous about starting college but everyone was so friendly, Stella & Amy were always in the office to help. I felt at ease from the start when Stella showed me around the training centre the rooms and kit was so clean.

I trained level 2&3 nail technician course, with my lovey and knowledgable tutor Joanna, she was really helpful plenty of one on one time in lessons as the classes are small (if your worried about not getting enough support don’t be!) She also was there overseeing if we weren’t sure on anything practical wise in lesson and theory wise via email. Would definitely recommend you’ll be in good hands here learning a variety of skills you need to succeed. Thank you ladies, so happy to of been a part of your school !

I had a great experience studying at Ray Cochrane Beauty Aesthetics Academy. I completed my VTCT Level 2 & 3 and VTCT Level 4 Laser qualifications here and successfully received my certificates.

The tutors are extremely professional and responsible. During one exam, a student had an unexpected issue, and the tutor stayed late until 7:30 pm to make sure the student could complete and pass the exam. This level of dedication really stood out.

At the beginning of the course, the teachers also checked in with us to see how we were adapting, which made the learning environment very supportive and reassuring. The training is well-structured, with a good balance of theory and hands-on practice.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for high-quality beauty and aesthetics training.

I recently completed the Level 2/3 Nail Technician course at Ray Cochrane and couldn’t be happier with my experience. The instructor, Joanna Prochera, is incredibly passionate, knowledgeable, and patient, which made learning both enjoyable and confidence-boosting. The entire team at Ray Cochrane were so friendly, welcoming, and always willing to help, creating a really supportive learning environment. I would 100% recommend this course to anyone looking to become a professional nail technician and start their journey towards self-employment.

I would strongly advise you save your money and  avoid this school.

I enrolled on the VTCT Level 2 & 3 combined course and was taught by a tutor called Pembe. Her behaviour was consistently passive-aggressive, condescending, and unprofessional. Instead of being supportive, she will make you feel small and embarrassed for not immediately understanding things. Good luck if she’s teaching you.

After completing the course end of Aug, I later found out that my VTCT certificates had been ready since October but I was never informed, despite chasing the centre several times. I only discovered this in January, while other students had already been notified.

What makes this especially troubling is that I was the only Black Muslim woman in my class and the only student who experienced this both from the tutor and in the way my certificate was handled. I am not making accusations but it is difficult not to question why one person was left out while everyone else was processed correctly.

When I raised this formally, instead of a proper apology and accountability, I was offered a £100 “goodwill” voucher for a future course. That response alone says a lot about how concerns about fairness and discrimination are handled at this school.

If you care about being treated fairly, receiving your certificates on time, and being respected as a student, I would avoid this school. The negative reviews are not exaggerated!

I cannot tolerate employees ignoring customers and felt the need to write this review. The attitude of the staff in this branch is generally like this anyway, but today when I went to collect my online order, there was one person in front of me in the queue. While one employee was dealing with that person, the queue quickly became five people including myself. Even though there were two other employees inside, they did not help the waiting customers — one was busy with something else, and the other was chatting with someone.

When it was finally my turn, the employee told me to find another staff member inside the store. I told them there was no one, yet they insisted in a rude manner and asked me to check again. When I went to the security guard, he told me there was no staff member inside the store and that I needed to go back to the till section. I explained that I had been sent from there, so he came with me and informed the staff himself that there was indeed no one inside to assist customers. After that, they still made me wait again before completing my order.

I was already annoyed because the order I placed on November 24th, which was supposed to be delivered on November 29th, was delayed by five days. Experiencing this behaviour on top of the delay made me even more frustrated. I really think the staff need to improve their attitude and professionalism. When I go to Boots, I feel like I’m at a GP surgery dealing with receptionists.

Terrible behaviour of the pharmacist, she first asked what I need and after I told her I need to consult something with her, she told me to wait as she needed to finished some stuff....
left me waiting more than 10 minutes while she was just unpacking some boxes there....

I went in asking one of the staff, Neil if they do anything for ear wax removal. He simply just said no and walked off. We had to ask another member of stuff for direction to another place and even then it wasn’t very helpful. Neil needs to either learn customer service or get sacked, because he could have told me the nearest place that does earwax removal

A small store with a good pharmacy section.
Very few members of the staff on the floor and the self service tills are always playing up so prepare to wait.
The make up section is quite good and the sandwiches are tasty.

Horrible, low availability of variety, unorganised.   I have linked my student discount with my boots card and it got disconnected. I try to do it again, in the same way I did before in other boots but they told me they don’t do it and if I want the discount I need to go to the other one. I just try to explain myself how the other one did but only answer no.  Better to walk a bit and go to Covent Garden one.

By 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean and fish. Over 95% of the plastic that we produce and consume, does not get recycled, but rather ends up in landfills, incinerators, and our oceans.

It is long past time for the small monopoly of purveyors in this city to provide their customers with better, more dignified options than this.

There are plenty of non-plastic choices available. Aluminum canned water, or glass bottled water.

But to normalize the mass sale and consumption of this much single use plastic is egregious.

We didn’t used to live this way. And we can’t afford to keep living this way. Thank you for considering how boots can help. It’s customers be better to this planet.

This is unacceptable. And just one of many stores peddling this pollution for profit.

The downfall with this chemist I asked the lady chemist to put my tablets very tiny tablets For my diabetes in a bottle as I suffer with a benign tremor, so when I get it out of the packet, I’m always dropping them on the floor and spend a long time looking for them and end up throwing them away and not taking my meds properly meaning missing out she clearly don't care that I suffer with this tremor and that I keep dropping that little tablets, my doctors told me that she should put them in little plastic bottle but I asked he lady whom does it and she will not do it and my sugar levels are badly out of control my GP chemist was shocked that she would not do this for me. So I may have to change chemist cause this reason it's sad when your chemist don't care about your situation with you having a benign trauma I just don’t wanna drop the tablets on the floor and my cat pick them up. I have to go on the floor looking for them and then I struggle getting a cup because I’m disabled. I’m getting sick of it. I’m getting sick of dropping them. They’re too tiny to take out of a packet if they were in a little plastic bottle I will be able to get them out easy but my Chemist, she will not do it so for this reason, I give Boots pharmacist bad reviews. They’re not very good. I’ll be honest with you. Try using another Chemist instead.

Came in for a flu jab at Boots Paddington Pharmacy. Ujala (apologies if I’ve misspelt the name) took care of my appointment quickly, she was friendly, chatty and kept me at ease the whole time. Thank you :)

I needed advice from a pharmacist to check interaction between cough medicine and my prescribed medication. The pharmacist was very polite and helpful and pointed me immediately to the correct product. Just what I needed.

Extremely Disappointed with Customer Service at Boots Paddington

I recently spent over £100 at the Boots store in Swansea, but was very disappointed with how I was treated when I visited the Paddington branch. One of the items I purchased, worth just £5.59, turned out to be faulty. I opened it on the train and went to Boots Paddington to request a refund.

Instead of receiving help, I was met with over 10 minutes of argument from a staff member in front of my child and other customers. She insisted that they don’t stock that brand and told me I had to find a different Boots branch that did – which is completely unreasonable for a national retailer with shared systems. I was made to feel like I was doing something wrong for returning a faulty product.

Eventually, I asked to speak with a manager. He came over but didn’t acknowledge me at all – no hello, no apology, nothing. He processed the return without saying a word. The lack of basic courtesy or empathy from both staff members was unacceptable.

It’s shocking that such poor service would be given over a £5.59 item, especially considering the amount I had just spent. I expected better from a company like Boots
This is one of the smallest, local Boots around and in need of a refurbishment. That said, it has a decent amount of stock and the security guard is very friendly.

Small shop, confusing checkout, a rude white woman staff at prescription counter. Better just install some self checkout machine. This kinda rude staff can be byebye if she cant be ask to even say a single word to customer while customer said Hi n thank u.
Small, fairly useless Boots. It "closes at 8 pm" so later than other pharmacies... But there's no pharmacist on shift after 7 pm so you can't get advice nor buy behind-the-counter items. Dumb.
the security guard in here genuinely brightens my day when I come in❤️ he's so lovely and will always make an effort to speak to everyone and help around the store if needed

really rude member of staff mon 4th aug morning who had poor communication skills. queued up to pay and instead of speaking to me she just points (unclear instructions and also just rude ) and when i moved to a diff desk she just called out ti me. not even speaking to me just calling out - honestly just bad manners and so rude. she had curly hair and bright lip stick and was carrying a wet floor sign after 11am! x

Amazing!
I recently visited St James Beauty and had an exceptional experience from start to finish. The clinic is incredibly modern, spotless, and equipped with some of the most advanced technology I’ve ever seen. I had laser hair removal using the Soprano Titanium system, and I was genuinely impressed.. it’s truly state-of-the-art, comfortable, and delivers outstanding results. The precision and 3D technology made the treatment fast, effective, and virtually painless.
The staff are professional, welcoming, and highly skilled. You can tell they care deeply about hygiene, customer comfort, and delivering top-quality service. The entire environment feels luxurious and very well maintained.
I also used their dental services, and just like the beauty treatments, the experience was excellent. Everything was handled with care, expertise, and modern equipment. It’s rare to find a place that excels in both beauty and dental services under one roof, but Saint James Beauty truly does.

I highly recommend EGO Health and Beauty to anyone looking for premium beauty treatments, advanced laser hair removal, or reliable dental care. This is easily one of the best, most modern, and most professional clinics I’ve ever visited. A true 5-star experience!

I had a great experience with my laser hair removal. The staff were kind, explained everything clearly, and made me feel comfortable. The treatments were quick, and I noticed a big difference after just a few sessions. Now the area is smooth with barely any regrowth. Definitely recommend this place 💯

Ewa and her team at EGO Health and Beauty Clinic are absolutely fantastic. From the moment you walk in, you feel welcomed and cared for. The clinic is beautifully maintained, calm, and professional. My treatment was explained clearly, carried out with real expertise, and the results were amazing. Ewa and her staff go above and beyond to make sure every client feels comfortable and valued. If you’re looking for exceptional health and beauty treatments in Victoria, Westminster, or Central London, I highly recommend Ewa and her wonderful team.

I recently visited St James Beauty in Central London for a laser hair removal treatment, and I honestly couldn’t be happier with the experience! From start to finish, the staff were incredibly warm, professional, and attentive. They made me feel completely comfortable and well looked after from the moment I walked in.

The clinic itself is beautifully clean, calm, and welcoming. The treatment was carried out with great care and precision, using high-quality equipment that felt both safe and effective. I noticed results quickly, and the whole process was far more comfortable than I expected.

What really stood out to me was how friendly and knowledgeable the team were — they took time to explain everything, answered all my questions, and made sure I felt confident and relaxed throughout. You can tell this is a place that truly values its clients.

If you’re looking for expert laser hair removal in London, I highly recommend St James Beauty. Their prices are very reasonable for the quality of care and service you receive, and the results are excellent. I’m already planning to return for more treatments!

Thank you again to the amazing team at St James Beauty — you’ve gained a loyal customer!
I have attended laser hair removal with Therapist Aditi and she has been awesome. The hygiene and professionalism is top notch. I would highly recommend this place.
A yakky parlour dont want to come again my foot

My friend and I had our nails done and it was a lovely experience. Chloe was my nail tech, she was very thorough, meticulous, and kind. I showed her some photos of what I was looking for and she did such a great job. My nails turned out super cute and I’m really happy overall!
Came in for a pedicure and loved it! Clean and modern salon, very friendly staff, fair prices. Will be coming back!

I have been coming here for years, hands down the best nails salon I have been to in London. Always consistent with the result. And never matter who does my nails everyone is equally excellent. Can’t recommend it enough. And staff are friendly and remember you.

I was so happy to see it refurbished! The place is beautiful the staff is kind and the nails are consistently perfectly done. My favourite place even though I don’t live in London anymore whenever I visit I come here.

My mum came in for a biab infill and gel pedicure which is what she booked through treatwell. She has always had her hands and feet done at the same time but today was told they categorically never do that, which was untrue as they’ve done it for her before.

The man doing her nails refused to perform the biab infill service, instead taking off her biab and doing a gel manicure, which is see through. My mum asked several times why he wasn’t using biab and why he was using gel but he kept telling her that she was wrong. He made her feel really pressured and uncomfortable and did not use any biab on her nails.
Very friendly staff. Didn't feel like my first visit. The technicians who saw to me were very knowledgeable and offered valuable footcare advise. Look forward to my next visit.

This was the worst nail and foot care experience I’ve ever had.

I booked a visit to Margaret Dabbs expecting the best nail salon in the UK, but it turned out to be a deeply disappointing experience. The pedicure was uncomfortable from the start — the therapist used a foot file so aggressively that white dust flew everywhere, which felt both embarrassing and suffocating. The manicure was equally unpleasant; the cuticle removal was so rough and painful that I discovered bleeding once I got home. To make matters worse, the nails were shaped so unevenly and unnaturally high that they exposed the nail bed, which felt extremely unprofessional. The “mask treatment” was rushed and careless, and the staff seemed eager to finish quickly rather than care for their clients.

On top of this, the salon felt noisy, crowded, and uncomfortable, making it hard to relax. I also had to wait past my appointment time before the service even began.

For the premium prices charged, this was a careless, unpleasant, and painful experience — definitely not what I would expect from a salon with such a reputation.

So I’ve been a few times and always had a relatively good service but I recently went for a medical pedicure and it was awful. The podiatrist was nice enough and apologised for the hastiness, which is why I didn’t say anything to the receptionist, but the more I think about it the more I’m annoyed. I paid £85 for a terrible experience. He removed my normal nail varnish with a drill, clipped my toe nails down to my skin and didn’t even examine why my nails were discoloured. I’m really disappointed and unfortunately it’s put me off going again.

Excellent podiatry and pedicure experience at MD Marleybone with Beatriz, who was knowledgeable, kind, and gentle with my injured nails. She renewed my feet beautifully and gave me an easy plan for healing and prevention of further issues. Thank you Beatriz!

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
I had a medical podiatrist assist me at Margaret Dabbs today — her name is Popi  — and I was so impressed. She was professional, knowledgeable, and skillful, and gave me a lot of reassurance throughout. I can honestly say it’s the best pedicure I’ve ever had. My feet have never looked or felt better. Highly recommended!

I had such a wonderful experience at this nail salon today. From the moment I walked in, the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. They took their time with my nails and were so precise and detailed throughout the entire process. I really appreciated the patience and care they put into their work. The atmosphere was calm and relaxing, and I left absolutely loving the final result. Highly recommend if you're looking for quality service and beautiful nails!
my first time being at the nails shop. They have done my nails really good and customer service was amazing. I walked out of the nail shop feeling happy. Will come back again.
This was my first time here and I am  so happy with my French manicure! Everyone was super nice, friendly, and professional. I will definitely be back!

This was my first time getting BIAB and I loved how it turned out. My technician, Lisa was great and really took her time doing my nails especially the nail art. I will definitely be visiting more regularly.

Went here for the first time today, amazing service! Really friendly people working there, Lisa did an amazing job on my nails. I got acrylics, they took great care with my cuticles, didn't make the nails too thick, and helped me pick out the colours - can't recommend enough!

I have been going to Chloe’s for years and so has my mother. The staff are always so friendly and welcoming. Jin is so talented. All I have to do is show her an image off instagram and she will create beautiful nail art. I get so many compliments. I always look forward to my next nail appointment! Thanks Jin and your team! ♥️💅🏼

It was my first time coming to Chloe’s and definitely not my last! The staff were so helpful and friendly and I absolutely loved my nails! Thomas was my nail technician and I said I wanted some christmas nail art - he went above and beyond with the designs, I am so happy with them!

Absolutely obsessed with my nails! 💅 The design is stunning, the shimmer base looks elegant under any light, and the big crystal gems add the perfect amount of glam without feeling too heavy. The shape is flawless and super flattering, and the tech paid great attention to detail. I’ve received so many compliments since getting them done! The service was friendly, patient, and professional from start to finish. Definitely one of the best nail experiences I’ve had. Will 100% be coming back. Highly recommend this place if you love beautiful, luxury-style nails! 💖

We have lived between London and NYC since 2012, visit every continent but Antarctica almost every year, so I’ve had my nails done in Australia, America, Africa, Asia, extensively this year, Italy last month.

I ALWAYS do gel manicures on my hands with chrome, regular polish on my feet, in the closest color to match the chrome hands.

London is always the hardest place in the world to find chrome; it’s easier to find chrome colors in remote Asia or Africa than London.

I’ve gone to the same nail salon near our house in Kensington for years, but they only have basic chrome options, so I’ve been searching for a new salon, and as we were leaving town for over a month, I also wanted to get my nails done so as to not have to hunt down a salon on holiday.

I always do the same two colors in summer, alternating between a rose chrome pink, or a magenta chrome.

My boyfriend called Chelsea salons (we lived in Chelsea prior to moving to Ken), and this place said they have hundreds of all 5 star reviews, and many many chrome colors.

I googled and saw they do NOT have positive reviews, but that doesn’t matter, as long as they have lots of chrome options (there’s no nail salon I’ve encountered in London that’s nearly as nice as my nail salon in Sydney - not to mention free champagne, but Sydney is more sophisticated than London; AND taught me about chrome, years ago).

We go in and I show the magenta chrome picture below, saying this is a color I do often (I always show the same photo for my desired chrome nail color) - do they have this color?

They assured me they did.

They started on my feet and picked out a regular polish for my toes they insisted would be the closest match (ironically an Essie I’ve owned for >10 years).

It’s happened before in London when they say that and it turns out they have nothing and I’m screwed (as they’ve done your toes whatever color they allege is the closest to the photo and then oops they don’t actually have anything similar to the picture in chrome for your hands), so I was already concerned, as by then they’ve put on your pedicure color, so you’re trapped and have to hope they’ll be able to match the chrome as they assured, since unlike every other country on earth, they don’t have specific chrome colors, i.e. most salons around the world paint your nails a white or black base then put the chrome on in whatever color you want, but this place said they’d have to paint my nails pink and then put chrome on to match the photo (ie whoops they don’t actually have the color as they alleged, but I don’t care how they get to the end result as long as they get there).

Turned out they have no different chrome options to my normal salon in Kensington, at a higher cost.

They suggested using their only pink chrome which was similar to the rose chrome I came in with, not like the dark magenta they had painted my toes (also note they refused to put chrome on my regular pedicure; the latest salon in Sicily was the first to suggest doing that and it worked wonderfully, if they’d just done that it could’ve resolved part of the problem, even though I’d have left with the same color I arrived with, and it wasn’t what I asked for).

Not only am I stuck with my first NON chrome manicure in over a year, but also tried to charge the £105 quoted even though I DONT HAVE CHROME, it’s the same gel manicure I always have BEFORE chrome is applied!

I’ll add he never used sealing/cuticle oil (never did my cuticles at all in fact), no lotion on my hands.

I came in with the rose pink chrome color below, asked for the magenta chrome with the plates and rings (third photo), which they ASSURED me they had, and left with the non-chrome final photo below.

The most annoying was they refused to apologise or acknowledge they simply shouldn’t have said they had the colour in the first place if they didn’t have anything close, so if I wanted to use their menial options for chrome, I would, by definition, have toes of a completely different color to my hands.

It shows the negative reviews are probably accurate.

I went to Chloe’s nail spa today and super satisfied with my new set 💕 staffs are always welcoming and sweet. They gave complementary lemon ginger tea and a biscuit while doing my nails. They always have the best technique and service!! Always come back for more beautiful nails 💅

This hotel is all about class. The staff are amazingly attentive and detailed oriented to ensure your entire experience is divine from beginning to end. The restaurant is spectacularly good and amazing that the entire menu is gluten free and accommodating to those with intolerances. Well done! Great for business meetings as well. I didn’t want to leave.

We stayed at One Aldwych over New Year’s for several nights and overall had a very pleasant stay, although there are a few details that could be improved.

The hotel has a boutique feel and the location is excellent. The staff were extremely friendly and professional, especially the doorman, who did a great job throughout our stay.

The spa was okay, but nothing particularly special. The pool and spa area felt a bit underwhelming and could benefit from better care, especially around New Year’s. The water station in the spa was out of order and the water canisters were often empty, which was disappointing.

The bar is beautiful and the drinks were very good. Breakfast upstairs in the restaurant was excellent, with a great selection and a very nice ambiance overlooking the lobby. Room service was also good, with a solid menu including classics like fish and chips.

One thing that was genuinely disturbing was being called by housekeeping at around 1:00 pm and again a couple of hours later after New Year’s Eve, despite the “Do Not Disturb” sign being on. The same thing happened again the following day. This should not happen.

Another odd detail was that after adding my partner’s name to the reservation upon arrival, the hotel began addressing me by her last name, and the final invoice was also issued in her name, even though the booking was under mine.

Overall, we had a good stay. The hotel feels more like a high-end business hotel than a holiday destination. For a longer holiday stay, a larger hotel with more facilities might be preferable, but with a few updates, this could be a truly excellent place to stay.

The staff and level of service is the best we have ever experienced. The Dome Suite is incredible, room service steaks were perfect! The in house florist Mark does a fantastic job with flowers in every room. Andrew the porter is 5 Stars and all our thanks to Hannah in guest relations for planning the most amazing stay! Don't forget to check out the spa too.

Our stay at One Aldwych in London was absolutely unforgettable — a true 5-star experience in every sense! From the moment we arrived in the heart of Covent Garden, we were blown away by the combination of elegant design, thoughtful amenities, and impeccable service that defines this iconic hotel. The beautifully styled rooms feel like luxurious private residences.

Its location is perfectly convenient - just steps from the West End theatres and some of London’s best dining and cultural attractions.

A huge highlight of our stay was the outstanding hospitality shown by Petra. Her warmth, attention to detail, and genuine care made us feel welcomed and valued throughout our visit. Whether offering insightful local tips, anticipating our needs, or simply checking in with a smile, she elevated our stay from excellent to exceptional.
If you’re looking for a luxurious London base with flawless service and thoughtful touches at every turn, One Aldwych is an absolute must — and Petra is the perfect ambassador of its warm, five-star spirit!

Had the Charlie and the chocolate factory afternoon tea as a christmas treat with 2 adults and 3 children. Our server Masum made it a memorable experience. Food was fabulous and the whole experience was a treasured memory with lots of special elements for the children. Highly reccomend

I recently enjoyed afternoon tea at the Courthouse Hotel, and it was a very pleasant experience. The selection of finger sandwiches was fresh and well-filled, and the scones were warm, light, and served with generous portions of cream and jam. The cakes were beautifully presented and not overly sweet.
There was a good variety of teas to choose from.  Ramadan Vidhi and the other staff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive, which made the experience relaxing. The setting was elegant and comfortable, perfect for a leisurely afternoon.
Overall, I really enjoyed the afternoon tea and would happily recommend it to others looking for a special treat.

I don't understand the low ratings this place has.  We thought it was great.  Great location, great staff,  seemingly recently updated room. Some super minor superficial issues with some of the furniture,  not even worth mentioning really,  but I suppose some perfectionist might care. We were there only one night and would have loved a few more nights there.  I plan to return.

Great hotel, everything was lovely apart from the breakfast. It had premier inn vibes. The food was very cold and the bacon was still breathing. The breakfast massively let this hotel down. It would have been 5 stars otherwise.

Title: Exceptional Stay in the Heart of Soho

I stayed at the Courthouse Hotel London from Sunday, September 21st through Thursday, September 25th, and had an absolutely wonderful experience. From the moment I arrived, the staff were friendly, professional, and incredibly accommodating—they went out of their way to make sure every detail of my stay was perfect.

The room was spotless, spacious, and very comfortable, with everything I needed to relax after a long day exploring the city. I also appreciated how well the hotel blended modern comfort with its historic charm—a true gem in the middle of Soho.

The location couldn’t be better—steps away from great restaurants, shopping, and entertainment, yet the hotel itself remained peaceful and relaxing.

A heartfelt thank you to the entire team at the Courthouse Hotel for making my stay so enjoyable. I look forward to returning on my next trip to London!

I would NO LONGER RECOMMEND.  We have stayed here multiple times before and it seems the hotel has taken a turn for the worse in the last two years.   Everything seems to be breaking down.

The first night we were out in a room where you could hear the party in the lobby until almost 11pm. Disappointing when you are arriving and jet lagged.  I spoke with the concierge/front desk and they said they would move us to a specific room the next day.

The next day I spoke with the hotel manager who immediately said no that room was not available. He seemed more inconvenienced than concerned.  He tried pinning the noise on the theatre next door. Either way the noise levels were unacceptable and i wouldn’t recommend for this reason.  After his refusal of the particular room we were told we were going to get we ended up in that room the second day.  The manager didn’t listen to our concerns but quickly rebutted them
Giving the impression he didn’t care or want to put effort.  It was easier for him to just say no.  Not once did I feel he took our concerns with care.

But wait theres more!

The hotel has two elevators neither of which have been serviced in some time.  Broken buttons, one of them would not accept guests from the main floor and the other had issues going to ground level.  In one instance we boarded and started towards ground floor and just stopped on the 4th floor loosing its destination trapping us in the elevator for about 5 minutes.  The call button wouldn’t work and finally after some panic it finally allowed us out and we used the stairs.

The hotel rooms used to be well taken care of.  Sadly not anymore.  Drapes were falling off the wall, big long black hairs in the bathroom and on the bed from housekeeping I presume as my partner is bald and I have a crew cut so it was not ours. The safety handle in the tub had been removed or broken off with rusty bolts and mounting gear sticking out.

Sadly we will be finding a new hotel which won’t be a problem in London.

The location is great but honestly not worth the price for the lack of professionalism, service and care.

We had the most amazing time at the spa and restaurant. There was a lovely girl at the spa with long dark hair and glasses (sorry I didn't get her name) who was so professional and kind. My treatment was also really lovely.
Big shout out to Amanda and Emmie in the restaurant who were really friendly and fun. The food and service was outstanding.
So good, I'm returning this Sunday. Highly recommend a visit.

Excellant spa and dining experience, limited facilities so appointments staggerred so that everyone gets the best experience to try out spa, sauna and steamroom. Went for a package that included 2 treatments so totally relaxed before dinner. Food was amazing so capped off a truly amazing experience.

What made it truly wonderful was the service, from the doorman to the spa receptionist, therapists and restaurant staff. If you want customer service this is the place to go, the staff were welcoming, friendly and attentive to our needs. Thank you for a our amazingvexperience.

I absolutely loved this hotel!!! One of my favorites of all time. The location is SUPERB - we wanted posh, and we got posh! Street-noise was low despite being a fairly busy street and it was extremely easy to get around from the hotel. The staff were all lovely and the rooms were beautiful and luxurious. We were warmly welcomed back to the hotel every time with the door held open and the staff was warm, chatting with us about things they recommend checking out.

The bed/pillows was one of my favorite aspects of the hotel - SO comfy and a delight to fall into after a long day of exploring. I also appreciated the little things they provided such as comfy robes, slippers, sturdy umbrellas, and some complementary mini-bar treats.

We initially had an issue with the window not closing fully but the staff came INSTANTLY and fixed it right up. They were overall SO quick with any request we had (such as extra coffee pods, extra silverware) and the room was lovingly cleaned and linens replaced every day.

Some things to note but not negatives: the infrastructure is a bit older than some modern hotels, but I found it very charming overall (i.e. the heat/AC controls were a little tricky, the lights were on a funny timer, the room was small-ish, and we could hear some upstairs noise). Nothing deal-breaking at all, just some quirks :)

I found this hotel to be a very fair price for what it offers, it lives up to the expectations of a 5-star hotel, and I would absolutely stay here again given the chance. Missing it already!

We had the pleasure of dining for dinner which we all enjoyed. The service provided by all the staff was incredible from the friendly doorman, reception, the kind gentleman in the bar and Osheen our amazing waitress who looked after us.

It is a beautiful hotel and hope to return to enjoy the spa facilities and stay overnight.

A perfect location and easy access to Green Park.

I almost never leave reviews but this experience truly deserved one. From the moment I arrived to the moment I checked out, the level of care and attention to detail was exceptional. Daniel and Mariusz went above and beyond in every way. They were warm, thoughtful and genuinely invested in making our stay special.

Their hospitality left a lasting impression on me and I couldn’t be more grateful.

Thank you.

The perfect venue for Olia and Jeremy’s wedding reception! The Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park is the definition of luxury. As a photographer, I was blown away by the opulent interiors and the breathtaking views overlooking the park - it provides a world-class backdrop for high-end wedding portraits.

The service was impeccable, and the grand architecture creates an atmosphere of pure elegance. If you want a reception venue that is both iconic and effortlessly photogenic, this is it. Absolute perfection from start to finish.

We had a wonderful stay at Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park to celebrate my wife’s birthday, and the experience was truly fantastic. Before our arrival, Selin, Gabrielle and Aneena from the guest experience team prepared a lovely birthday surprise and made us feel genuinely welcomed. Upon arrival, Rhea from the front of house team was very friendly and arranged a beautiful suite with a great view.

A special highlight was the warm welcome from Mark at breakfast the next morning, which set the perfect tone for the day.

Overall, the hospitality we received made us feel truly cared for and elevated the entire experience. Thank you to the team for making our celebration so memorable. We can’t wait to return!

I used to really enjoy coming to Mandarin Oriental for afternoon tea, but a recent experience completely changed my impression.

Last week, we called to make a reservation and simply wanted to clarify whether there would be a charge for our one-year-old baby. Instead of answering the question clearly, the staff member on the phone was surprisingly arrogant and dismissive. We were told there is a “kids menu” costing tens of pounds, which honestly makes little sense for a child just over one year old.

What disappointed me most was not the policy itself, but the attitude. A simple, polite explanation would have been enough. This interaction felt unwelcoming and left us with the impression that families like ours are not valued.

If this venue is only meant to cater to the ultra-wealthy and not ordinary guests, perhaps prices should be raised even further so expectations are clearer. Unfortunately, this experience has completely put us off, and we will not be returning.

We loved, loved this hotel. Our junior suite was beautiful and a welcome respite at the end of a busy touring day.  Housekeeping was impeccable.   The staff could not have been kinder and went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. We were traveling with a three year old and they were very sweet to her, as well.  The concierge was pressed into service numerous times for dinner reservations and he always made good suggestions.

All in all, our week in London was a joy and the Mandarin Oriental Hotel helped make it so!

We had the privilege to be served by Juliette and wanted to share with the management team about our experience with her.
She was a delight to interact with and demonstrated professionalism, attention to details and care.
We could not have asked for a better server for our first experience at the Mandarin Hotel Hyde Park for High Tea.

Lovely afternoon tea at the Rosewood hotel. The staff is attentive and welcoming and the menu is well thought and accurately  presented. We enjoyed the selection of savoury and sweet treats. A perfect way to spend a few hours in a relaxed ambiance. The hotel was nicely decorated for Christmas too!

I stayed at the Rosewood for six nights, at nearly £1,000 per night. The room itself was luxurious and very comfortable, the lobby was beautiful, and housekeeping was meticulous.

However, my overall experience was mediocre for a five-star hotel, with nothing truly exceptional to mention. I did not receive a warm welcome from the staff at the entrance or at reception. There was no small talk, no sense of hospitality—overall, a very bland experience.

I am from Qatar and wear a headscarf. On several occasions, staff members spoke directly to my husband without acknowledging me or even making eye contact. This felt strange and uncomfortable. I am unsure whether they assumed it was inappropriate to address me directly or assumed I could not speak English. Either way, it was disappointing. I travel frequently to Europe and the United States, and I have never experienced this kind of treatment before.

Breakfast was also mediocre. The buffet was only available on weekends, while weekdays offered a set menu with very limited options.

Overall, while the hotel is visually impressive and well maintained, the experience itself felt average and did not meet the expectations of a true five-star hotel.

First, let me say that if I could give half stars I would give the Rosewood 4.5 stars, not 5.
I reference other five star hotels in major cities, especially London, that I have stayed in.  The Rosewood London is very good, but a tad not quite there.
To be fair, the staff are wonderul.  Everyone I interacted with was first rate.  From doormen to front desk to housekeeper, all wonderful.  That includes the reservation staff who emailed me about my early check in request.  All were a joy to deal with.  Kudos to the entire team, at least the ones I saw.
I stayed two separate times within 6 days, using London as a layover for my trip west.  Both times I booked a premier executive room, hoping to score an upgrade since I used the Amex FHR program.  Both times I failed to catch a break.  Not that they have to, of course.  The hotel must be totally full on both occasiins then.  Right?  And the second stay?  What a great room with a view of AC units and construction next door (see pics).  Not the hotel's fault, of course, that these things were there.  But not what I had hoped.
In the room on my second stay, the toilet us located right next to the entrance to the shower.  Kinda squeezed and it's quite easy to drag your towel onto the toilet rim.  Not very nice.
No luggage rack per se, so I placed the luggage on the stool at the foot of the bed.  And then moved thr stool to the middle of the room because I really didn't want the dirtt luggage surface to touch the bed.  Am I weird?  I think not.
Oh, the hotel provides a sense of welcome with a welcome amenity.  Three, yes count them, three mandarin oranges.  Better than nothing I guess.
Something else annoys me.  They put a service charge to the bill for the room and for the restaurant.  Fine.  But then they say the service charge is not included in the hotel credit I get.  In other words, I have to pay extra for the service charge THEY put on even if my total restaurant bill comes below the allowed credit.  Come again?  I could ask for the service charge to be removed,bai guess.  But that's not my point.  They impose something on the customer, albeit "voluntary," and then say it's extra to the creditbupu you get.  There's someting unsavoury about this nickle and diming for a hotel this calibre.
But hey, in the lift lobby on each floor is bowl of candies!
Overall the hotel is clean, relatively spacious rooms depending on the category you book.  Generally quiet with minimal interior and external noises.   Service level is high.  Nice toileteries.  Not a bad choice at all especially if you spot a good price relative to other five star properties.  AND, the Holborn Dining Room is absolutely marvelous!

This beautiful hotel is perfectly situated close to Covent Garden. But what sets it apart is the staff--so kind, so attentive, and completely unpretentious. We had a marvelous 5-day stay where the concierges and reception staff accomodated special requests from us with ease. I recommend this hotel HIGHLY--it will be one of the best parts of your trip!!

We stayed two nights at the Rosewood London and had an excellent stay. Thank you to all the teams for their warm welcome and professionalism. We would especially like to thank the bar team, with whom we had a great time.

This hotel used to be my absolute favourite in London - a place I genuinely loved and regularly visited.

My friend and I have been frequent guests over the years: dining in their restaurants, visiting all three bars, having lunch and dinner there, and even staying at the hotel multiple times. We were well known to the staff and always felt welcome - until today.

Today, an incident occurred that completely spoiled our day, our mood, and our desire to return - even to the restaurant.

We simply walked in to make a reservation for one of the hotel’s restaurants for next week. My friend was holding a takeaway coffee. At the entrance, a woman (possibly a concierge) looked at us and, in a cold and unfriendly tone, asked: “Can I help you?” — not as a polite greeting, but as if we needed to justify our presence.

Shortly after, my friend was asked to leave the hotel entirely because she had a takeaway coffee. The way this was handled felt unnecessary, inhospitable, and frankly humiliating - especially for regular guests who have supported this hotel for years.

I asked to speak to a manager. He apologised -which I appreciate - but the damage was already done.

Luxury is not just about interiors or reputation. It is about how people are made to feel. Unfortunately, one unprofessional interaction was enough to turn what was once my favourite hotel in London into a place I no longer feel welcome in.

It is deeply disappointing when individual staff behaviour undermines the image of a hotel that prides itself on excellence.

Wow wow wow. What can I say? A beautiful weekend spent at the connaught. The staff were exceptional and extremely welcoming. Sigrid looked after us from start to finish and helped plan the perfect proposal. Beautiful experience. Thank you so much to the connaught.
