We stayed for a few nights in the middle of January.  Great service (attention to detail was amazing), the food is fantastic (at all of the restaurants), the staff were warm and welcoming, the room was spacious and clean - and it’s in a wonderful location! Thank you for a delightful stay

Review of the Connaught Bar

Is a drink worth £30 + 15% service charge?

Yes — the Connaught Martini is worth it.

This is a masterclass in restraint and precision: table-side customisation via the iconic martini trolley, The Connaught’s own gin, bespoke bitters, and a choice of vermouths, all delivered with calm, faultless service. The result is a refined, layered martini that’s far beyond the standard.

It’s undeniably expensive and very much a splurge — but as a once-in-a-lifetime bar experience, the quality, ritual, and execution fully justify the price. 🍸

Extremely disappointing experience – Poor service and lack of inclusivity

I had a deeply unsettling experience at The Connaught this Boxing Day that has ensured I will never return.

After dining in Mayfair, my two friends and I decided to head to the bar at the Connaught for a nightcap. I specifically called ahead to confirm their hours given it was boxing day; the staff member on the phone explicitly told me the bar was open until 1:00 AM, with last orders at 12:30 AM. I even asked if a booking would be required to which he assured me it would not.

Upon arriving at 12:08, we were met by groups of loud individuals loitering outside. Inside the lobby, the first thing we noticed was a pungent smell of urine. For a hotel of this reputation, the physical state of the reception was shocking—it has moved past "classic charm" into being visibly dilapidated and in need of urgent renovation.

The most distressing part of the evening, however, occurred as we approached the bar. A member of the front desk staff (an Irish gentleman) literally ran toward us to intercept us, aggressively stating the bar was closed. Even after I showed him my call logs proving I had been told otherwise just minutes prior, he remained dismissive and unapologetic. Despite his claims, the bar was clearly bustling with patrons inside.

The way we were approached—being run at as if we were common criminals—left us feeling targeted, racially profiled, and unwelcome. It was a humiliating encounter that ruined our holiday evening.

This establishment clearly needs to invest in modernizing its facilities and, more importantly, providing rigorous sensitivity and diversity training for its front-of-house staff. I would strongly advise against visiting if you expect a professional or inclusive environment.

My partner and I stayed at The Berkeley and were absolutely delighted. The level of care and attention from the staff was beyond anything we’ve experienced before – everyone was friendly, professional, and always ready to help with a smile.

The rooms are elegant, bright, and wonderfully spacious, with perfect climate control that made our stay incredibly comfortable. They’re ideal for relaxing after a day exploring London. The spa is truly outstanding, offering a world-class experience of pure relaxation.

An exceptional hotel in every way – we’ll definitely be back!

The Berkeley offers a refined and comfortable stay with elegant interiors and attentive service. Rooms are spacious, clean, and well-maintained, providing a relaxing atmosphere for both business and leisure travelers. The staff is courteous and professional, and the overall ambience reflects quality, comfort, and a touch of sophistication.

A special thank you to Austin and John, who were exceptional. They went above and beyond by suggesting a smart solution for my luggage: instead of shipping an empty suitcase back to Jordan at a cost of around £200, they kindly recommended storing it securely at the hotel until my return. It was thoughtful, practical, and clearly done with my best interest in mind. That level of consideration is rare.

Mark, from the bell team, was equally professional and helpful, handling everything smoothly and efficiently with a calm, reassuring attitude.

I’d also like to thank Sid and Daniel at the front desk/concierge. Sid, in particular, impressed me by remembering my name and room number in such a large hotel, a small detail, but one that speaks volumes about attentiveness and care.

Overall, this was one of the friendliest and most pleasant hotel experiences I’ve had. The team made me feel genuinely looked after, and those personal touches truly set The Berkeley apart.

The family I come here with have been coming for decades. This is the top most, personable hotel in the world in my opinion. You will be treated like a queen/king. Today was my birthday and I was brought a gorgeous cake and card by a lovely man called Ion. And then I was spoilt further by the delightful Pablo and Jasmin at the terrace!
Genuinely beautiful souls service you at the Berkeley!

Superb and Faultless. I loved the fact that the staff made us feel like their own extended family. The staff went out of their way to look after us. A special thank you to Andrea at concierge reception desk. My wife and I stayed at the hotel to celebrate our baby son's one year old birthday. I am pleased to say that we had a memorable and personalised experience.
The actual location is prime. Very good if you are a tourist in London for the first time.

We came here for a coffee and found it quite disappointing. The setting and table were lovely and there was a nice ambience however it was hard to get the attention of staff.

We were initially served tea in takeaway cups despite having had a booking made in advance and we had to ask for proper cups and a teapot.
The toast we ordered did not have butter with it and was cold also.

No pastries were available too which was disappointing.

Disappointing experience overall.

Our stay at the four seasons park lane was MAGNIFICENT!!! The turn-down service was incredible and they housekeep staff went above and beyond to make our room look brand new.  We ate several nights during our one week stay at the Pavyllon restaurant and Bar Antoine. The staff which included Cindy, Marine and MOST importantly T or “Mr. T” made our dining experience a perfect 10.  I will be coming back here with my family and look forward to seeing this incredible
Staff for world-class food and world class service. Thank you so much! (The pic was the bone marrow dish which was EXCELLENT)

Tamas has been absolutely amazing we are travelling to the UK and required to use the rest room and he was accommodating.

We will most certainly be booking to stay here over the New Years!

Thank you Tamas!

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Exceptional Stay – Highly Recommended!

I recently stayed at this hotel and was absolutely blown away by the experience. From the moment I arrived, the staff was warm, welcoming, and incredibly attentive. The check-in process was smooth, and I was even offered a complimentary drink while I waited.

The room was spotless, stylishly decorated, and equipped with everything I needed for a comfortable stay—plush bedding, a spacious bathroom, and a beautiful view from the balcony. Housekeeping did a fantastic job each day, keeping everything pristine.

One of the highlights was the on-site restaurant. The food was outstanding, with a great variety of options for breakfast and dinner. I also appreciated the hotel’s amenities—especially the pool and fitness center, which were both clean and well-maintained.

Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. Whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, this is a perfect choice. I can’t wait to return!

I had a wonderful experience! Everything was clean, comfortable, and well maintained. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout my stay, and the service exceeded my expectations. I really appreciated the attention to detail and how smooth everything went. Highly recommended I’d definitely come back again!

My stay at COMO Metropolitan London was truly outstanding in every way.

The rooms are beautifully designed, spacious, extremely clean, and very comfortable, creating a perfect atmosphere for relaxation after a long day in London. The attention to detail and quality of amenities reflect the high standards of the hotel.

The service is exceptional. Every member of the staff is genuinely kind, professional, and always ready to help with a warm smile. They made me feel welcomed and valued throughout my stay.

The location is absolutely perfect—situated in the heart of Mayfair, just steps away from Hyde Park, shopping areas, and major attractions. Everything is easily accessible, making it ideal for both business and leisure travelers.

What truly touched me was the hotel’s thoughtful gesture on my birthday. I was pleasantly surprised to find a beautiful gift waiting in my room, which made my stay even more special and unforgettable. This level of care shows how much they value their guests.

COMO Metropolitan London is a hotel that delivers not only comfort and luxury but also heartfelt hospitality. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an exceptional experience in London.

I had an incredible stay at COMO Metropolitan London. All the staff members were truly amazing and made us feel very welcome. Daniela greeted us with a warm smile, gifted my son a small present, and even offered to help arrange our trip, which was very thoughtful. We also received great support from Chencno with our luggage transfer, making everything very smooth and easy. The check-out process was seamless, and we really enjoyed the friendly conversations with Iolanda. The reception team were especially kind and attentive to my son. Overall, an outstanding experience and a memorable stay. Highly recommended!

I had a really lovely stay at COMO London. The hotel is beautiful, calm & very comfortable.
The staff truly made the experience special. Mariyam was so kind, attentive, and welcoming. Ali was always helpful and professional, Vita was warm and thoughtful, Mateusz was very polite and efficient, and Iolanda was lovely and caring. Chencho also brought such a positive, friendly energy that made everything feel easy. They all made us feel genuinely well looked after.
I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Truly a wonderful experience from start to finish. The management team was extremely welcoming and made everything smooth and pleasant. A special thank you to Ali, the doorman — such a great person with a genuine smile, professionalism, and outstanding hospitality. He really sets the tone and makes you feel valued the moment you arrive. Highly recommended!

The hotel was amazing. The location is truly strategic and made everything so easy. The room was spacious, comfortable, and gave a very relaxing vibe. The service was exceptional and incredibly fast, and the moment you walk in you can smell the most calming, beautiful scent in the lobby.

A special thanks to Ali — he was outstanding, very helpful, and has such a great attitude. Honestly, everyone at the hotel had a lovely and positive spirit.

Definitely a place I would come back to. 🤍✨

This was the perfect stay for a mix of business and pleasure. The room was great, nice size, good desk to work from. Location is perfect, with shops and restaurants/cafes and underground station all within walking distance.

The pool area is gorgeous, definitely the main event for me. Perfect break away from my laptop working. Pool, sauna and steam room, open from 6am which is ideal to make use of before work.

Staff were particularly helpful. Special mention to Anna from reception. I had only planned to stay 1 night, but decided to extend and she couldn’t be more helpful and attentive with my questions and helping me book the same room again.

I would stay here again, thank you

Very comfortable hotel and comparably priced to others of this quality. Walking distance to Chelsea, Kensington and Buckingham Palace if you’re happy to stroll. Tea/coffee offering at breakfast needs improvement (who in the UK makes tea from hot water in a flask) and they could do more with the quality ingredients they use to showcase a proper English breakfast (greasy bacon, pale sausages and rubbery fried eggs). As a Guest Club member we were very disappointed not to receive any acknowledgment from the reception staff nor our complimentary upgrade (yes, we checked and the rooms were available).

I stayed at the Pestana Chelsea Bridge Hotel & Spa for two nights just after Christmas, looking for a short break and a bit of luxury. I usually stay with chains like Leonardo or Hilton, so I’m probably comparing service levels as well as facilities.

The location is a real highlight. Battersea Park is directly opposite and Battersea Power Station is a short walk away, which is great for food, shopping and walks.

The bed was extremely comfortable and the blackout curtains were excellent. The spa facilities were clean and quiet when we used them, though quite small, and the gym is very limited.

There were some disappointments for a hotel at this price point. The room I booked wasn’t set up as requested, the walls were thin, and the room felt under-stocked (limited toiletries and tea/coffee). Breakfast was probably the weakest part of the stay: items ran out quickly, there was no self-serve hot drinks machine, and guests often had to ask staff for basics like cutlery, bowls or coffee. Staff service was mixed – some were helpful and pleasant, while others came across as abrupt, and one hygiene issue I observed was concerning.

Overall, it was an okay stay rather than a standout one. Great location and comfort, but the service and attention to detail didn’t quite match what I’d expect for the cost.

My husband has already left a separate review for this hotel, but it’s worth another mention because it has been absolutely brilliant! After a rocky start to our honeymoon, we booked Pestana Chelsea Bridge last minute to try and make the most of the last few days of our trip. It’s safe to say it completely made our honeymoon and we will definitely be returning. The room was lovely, spacious and clean and the bed was so comfy! The breakfast buffet was one of the best we’ve had, with plenty of attentive staff and every kind of breakfast option you could imagine. The pool and spa was incredible, beautiful dim lighting making it so relaxing with plenty of space to chill and enjoy. And finally, all the staff were so lovely! We’ve already given Anna a shout out in the other review, but it needs mentioning again how great she was! From upgrading our stay to decorating the room with petals and complimentary cakes, Anna went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable so we want to thank you so much for that! Overall amazing hotel, and like I say we will definitely be back ☺️

First time in London and what a treat! Flew in from Canada taking the red eye landing on Nov 1.
At Pestana Chelsea Bridge hotel Stephanie and Angela helped to welcome us after a long journey and my husband and I could not be more Thankful for their hospitality and the early check in as we definitely needed the couple extra hours of rest before we went exploring through Battersea. They even supplied us with  a universal adapter so that we did not need to purchase one. The amenities and location of this hotel was fantastic. From the gorgeous pool, to the futuristic steam room to the sauna, all were new, clean and above my expectations as compared to many hotels.

Spotlighting the dedication and service this hotel offers, we’d like to make sure Syed Shoeb Ahmed is recognized as he went out of his way to ensure our stay was perfect. We had gotten back to our hotel room (near midnight) and had received a note written by the front desk staff regarding the inconveniences related to our room due to the inconsistent temperatures. We went to the front desk and Syed was able to make it right for us ensuring we were accommodated with a comfortable and gorgeous room and because we switched our room so late into the night, he ensured we could have late checkout. Wow!

On the morning we left, Karin ensured we had a proper sendoff, ensuring my departure to the airport was seamless. From arrival to departure, this team showed such warmth and hospitality. We will be back soon with our 3 kids! Thank you all!

Amazing place to go swimming. They have 2 pools, one inside and one outdoor, both heated. Can get pretty crowded after work but if you can go before that it’s super chill. Lifeguards are always on duty and they even give some tips on technique. Definitely recommend their student discount as well

A gem of a pool that truly lives up to its description. I mainly use the outdoor pool and sauna, and the recent refurbishment of the paving stones has made a major aesthetic improvement. Combined with friendly staff, the place has a welcoming, social atmosphere that’s greatly appreciated.

The male changing rooms are currently closed for an extensive overhaul, which will hopefully retain the existing open-plan design while addressing plumbing issues — hot water wasn’t always reliable. In the meantime, the gym changing rooms are a workable alternative, though they feel comparatively cramped due to the shower cubicle arrangement.

We were visiting and it was very hot in London, so it was great to be able to find a place to swim. It was a little challenging to set up an account sign up to swim as you needed to have a local  post Code, but we figured it out.  We only use the pool and they changing areas.

Who knew that there was an outdoor swimming pool right in the middle of Covent Garden? Clean, well kept facilities with really lovely changing rooms. The pool opens at 0630am and the sauna at 730am. Perfect for before work.

Incredible venue hidden right in the centre of London. Love the pool, gym and classes. Outdoor pool is the star of the show and all staff I have encountered have been incredible. Gym is nice and clean too!

Best experience we ever had!
We stayed in the lovely pink room which is super luxurious.
We felt welcomed from the beginning to the end. Staff is not only friendly but also the quality of service is top notch. We had a lovely time also in the Spa with an excellent aqua facial.
If you’re looking for high quality, luxurious stay and feel at home in the center of London this is the place to stay.

I visited with friends last week for Spa treatments following an overnight stay the previous week.  I love this hotel.  Everyone is friendly, polite and welcoming.  The Christmas decorations this year are the best ever.  Thank you to Asia, Justina and Dr Galyna for the pampering and making me feel so special.  We had a lovely lunch in the spa, the Chicken Cesear salad was delicious as were the juice shots.  Thank you again for such a wonderful day.

Amazing stay! Got upgraded to the beautiful junior suite which was very cozy, clean, and traditional. Everyone who works at the hotel is incredibly kind and helpful. The library bar has amazing drinks and food. We usually like to check out a different hotel every year we visit London, but we will definitely make the Lanesborough the "usual"!

Absolutely incredible! I can’t recommend this hotel enough: the staff, the service, the location, amenities and rooms were amazing. By far the best property I’ve stayed in London (this is my 9th visit). The property truly feels like home and the level of hospitality and detail were unmatched. It was quiet, serene & so cozy. I will be 100% staying here again. A special thank you to the staff who made my stay here so special.

Had a staycation here and it fell short of expectations. Email comms and front of house staff not good at all in my experience, very shocked and was disappointed with the room and overall stay. Our butler was a disaster - everything was wrong, had organised something at a specific time to arrive and completely missed the mark - and timing. On our last night he chased us down the corridor with a light jog to let us know he had arranged the room for us and we won’t see him again so to be sure to write about our experience. We assumed the following, which felt like hassling, was to ensure we remembered to tip. Would never not tip, ever, but felt very disappointed by the “chase” as we called it. By arranged the room he meant turn down had been done - there was not even so much as a chocolate on the pillow. Upon this turn down, water hadn’t even been re stocked, and with no kettle in the room anyway, left us needing to call for more. The butler ignored the bell call 😂 we didn’t get it.

Service in all the dining areas and the doormen was wonderful, food very good. And yes Michael in the library as mentioned below many times really is a superstar - what a gem they have in their team. Kieran and Daniel at the front also great.

I won’t stay again, claridges has always been much more wonderful, and the Connaught never disappoints, but I will absolutely continue to dine.

Attended with a group of friends and really pleased and impressed by the venue. Yes it is smaller than the other saunas, but it is CLEAN, the layout really nice, great jacuzzi, nice bar and chill out area. Would definitely attend again with my pals. Steam room could be warmer, but are you really there for the steam?

Very nice spa. Staff were friendly. Place was kept very clean. Couches and benches all well maintained. Facilities are all good. The place IS small. Okay, that’s livable. I would have liked to have seen a pure dark room (no light) where you could introduce yourself anonymously and some glory hole areas like in a multi-level room.

I don’t understand where all these bad reviews are from, or this was in the past. I’ve had really nice experience in this sauna. Staffs were continually working and keeping the place clean as possible. I have to say it was quite, but there was enough hot guys around to have fun with. I’ve been there actually for massage and massage from Sergio was so so good. Thanks and see you soon.

I can’t believe the level of customer service and support they provide! Atrocious management, poorest of services, attitude problems with customers !
Fernando whoever is at the door is an embarrassment! He should have some sort of customer service experience before jumping into a role dealing with the public.
I wasn’t aware that upon arrival we had to say if we needed a small or a bigger towel as their towels are very small.
So I went back to the bar to get exchanged, he point blank said : bar is closed ! So I went out to get another towel. He said no you can’t come out like that !
All i wanted was a bigger towel. He could’ve easily sorted that…. So asked me to leave. No questions asked I left. NEVER TO RETURN!
AVOID AT ALL COSTS ! Horrid behaviour
Absolutely unacceptable

My first visit earlier today and I do not know where the negative reviews come from. Reception very friendly and informative.  Facilities excellent.  Lovely comfortable and relaxed feel. Clientele mixed which was nice. Excellent spa far better then Pleasuredome and locker room..  Will make this my regular place to visit. THANK YOU

I’ve been using the Cannon St Nuffield Health for 10+ yrs. In that time I’ve seen its standards drops significantly. Filthy (frequently flooded) toilets / changing rooms, no toilet paper (and use the gym at 06:30), intermittent wifi and pretty disinterested staff (not all however)… the list goes on. Having the squash courts is fantastic and the club keeps up well with equipment and exercise trends. The cleanliness is a real issue and, for the first time, I’m contemplating allowing my membership to lapse.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Nuffield Health City Fitness & Wellbeing Gym has been an amazing place to train. The facility is always clean, well-maintained, and never feels overly crowded. The equipment range is top-tier—from strength machines and free weights to a great selection of cardio gear.

The staff here are friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely supportive. Whether it’s showing proper form or offering quick guidance, they’re always happy to help. The wellbeing side of the gym really shows too—nice recovery areas, good class options, and a relaxed atmosphere.

Overall, a great place to work on both fitness and wellbeing. Highly recommended!

The gym is well-equipped but is clearly very oversubscribed, working out on a Thursday evening is almost impossible and the spa/sauna areas during this time is at-capacity. It almost feels like they shouldn't be taking any more memberships or should launch an off-peak discount membership. The price rises every year but it feels like the quality of the facilities does not increase. (The price rise is above inflation).

Outside of peak it's wonderful, but the cleanliness is very hit-and-miss, the cleaners do a good job but it does feel like there isn't enough of them.

Front desk is generally pleasant and friendly. Had a horrible week of workouts when no hot water for the showers or the spa, no compensation offered, often feel like paying full cost for a half-maintained gym.

My sister and I visited a few clubs in the Nuffield Health Collection Plus range and were really impressed with Nuffield Health City Fitness & Wellbeing Gym. While the facilities are excellent, what truly stood out was Summer Moran.

Summer gave us a thorough tour of the club, was incredibly knowledgeable about everything on offer, and took the time to answer all our questions without ever making us feel rushed. She explained the membership options clearly and stayed in touch afterwards with absolutely no pressure to join.

In our view, what makes a club isn’t just the facilities - it’s the people. We’ve since joined Nuffield Health and are really looking forward to visiting the club again and bumping into Summer for a chat and a laugh, just like during our tour. If you’re thinking of joining Nuffield City, we highly recommend asking for Summer. You’ll be in very good hands!

I’ve had a really good experience at this gym. The facilities are solid and there’s everything I need for a good workout. What really stands out though is the reception team — Macy and Steven are always friendly, professional, and super helpful. They make every visit feel welcoming and smooth. Thanks to them, the place has a great atmosphere. Keep up the good work!

Great crowds with great facilities.
Had a lot of fun at the steam room.
Must bring a slipper / flipflop to visit for better hygiene or you can purchase at the bar.
Very weird payment system and weird system to enter to the steam room.
You make payment and you keep you valuable items at the payment counter, you received a key for locker then you need to go to the bar to exchange the wristband to enter to the sauna.
Crowds are very respectful, I feel comfortable as an Asian here.
Bad experience on the visit was the "poo smell" at the staircase, should be someone mess up but the venue unable to clean.
Overall it's a great place to have fun.
* Visited on Sunday around 8pm.

Some of the staff are nice others are OK but taking their job bit seriously like that blonde American one who works there, I hope he is getting paid £££'s for his job 😂😂 This is the most popular gay sauna in London would be nice for good customer service from everyone on all levels and maybe a bit of understanding for customers sometimes. The sauna itself is OK. Bit dirty in places needs a refurb.  Clientele is alright. Left the sauna feeling like I had an OK time.

This is not my first time at Sweatbox, however the deteriorating standard of operations and hygiene make It impossible not to acknowledge… After you have made It past the sassy receptionist and been appointed your jail cell locker, you will enter the main reception where you will enter a war of checking out/checking in/box retrieving chaos that exists due to sweatbox’s unique system that doesn’t allow customers back to their locker. Annoying, but fine. Once you scan your bracelet and proceed through the silver turnstile you will descend into the grotesque pits of hell… maybe faster than anticipated if you are one of the lucky ones to slide down the lubricated stairs. By now, If you haven’t already inhaled the horrific smell, you will once entering the steam room maze which is however, architecturally one of the most redeeming parts of the place... Descending deeper into the cruising space is only for the brave and those who were smart enough to bring their own shoes. Many men here don’t know the meaning of NO and as a young guy on a Monday, I was followed, pulled, pushed and grabbed many times after saying no or simply removing a hand, maybe that is your thing? If you are lucky to find a match, you have the pleasure of discovering one of the strange sized, uncleaned cabins decorated with lube, used condoms and bodily fluids on both sides. If this isn’t already a turn off beware of breathing through the nose to avoid inhaling again the smell of piss, shit, death and decay.
I have been to saunas all around the world and none have left me feeling as disgusting as my last trip to Sweatbox.. The standard of this place is absolutely abysmal compared to every other gay sauna in Europe which is pretty embarrassing considering that this is LONDON?! Honestly I understand more the attitude of the workers, I too would be acting this way if I had to endure staying in this place for a whole shift.. I don’t plan on returning and would recommend doing the same. Unfortunately one star is the minimum.

Been twice in the past  couple months, only in sunday and after 8 or 9 pm. Not crowded but at this times but had very good fun,  the staff were friendly and nice to my partner and me.  Mixed young and order people all ethinicities so had great fun.

The worst sauna experience I've had:
(visited sunday)
Security: questionable handling of surveillance and data privacy. As someone familiar with digital security, I found their approach potentially unsafe.

The app: requests excessive permissions and seems to collect more personal data than necessary.

Staff attitude: witnessed extremely unprofessional and disrespectful behaviour toward clients.

Cleanliness: serious hygiene issues in the wet area; it didn’t seem properly maintained.

Smell: strong and unpleasant chemical odour that lingered afterwards, even after proper washing.

Value for money: overpriced services, low-quality towels, and extra charges for replacements. Bringing your own items is not allowed, which forces you to buy their expensive products.

Clientele: mostly older visitors; the place might not meet expectations if you’re looking for a social or energetic environment.

Competitors: other venues nearby offer a much better and cleaner experience for the same or lower price.

Tourist experience: not very friendly to non-locals; staff are reluctant to repeat rules or explain things clearly in English.

was not able to say what was floating all around in sauna, as it is too naturalistic description for wider publication.

overpriced for what it is.
I just did the spa experience without a massage or any additional treatment. People are loud and chatty in the spa and it feels more like a community water park for friends to have fun at than a spa. £49 for a two hour slot just to go to a steam room and sauna to me feels excessive. especially for a place that calls itself part of the better health group.

What a gem of a place - this feels too good to be true, it's a proper London secret weapon. Beautiful interiors, top notch facilities and attentive staff, plus a very easy and thoughtful flow - robes, towels and flipflops provided, nice toiletries in the showers and endless herbal teas and infused water. It could be 3 times the price and a spa session here would still represent amazing value.

I had such an amazing body treatment by Vidya. She was very attentive and respectful during my session and made me comfortable and understand each process as well as great advice on treatment care. Would defo recommend xx

Great venue, my wife went for a 90-minute massage and aromatherapy.

She came out like a rubber band, relaxed,muscle pummeled to within an inch of their tolerance in a good way.

What appreciated about the treatment was the value for money. It doesn't feel like you are paying for the establishment over heads.

You are laying down money for the treatment.

Highly recommended.

A little overdue but wanted to leave a review! I was fortunate enough to be treated by a friend to a facial and access to the spa for my birthday. I cannot think of another time I had felt so relaxed. Elena helped me book over the phone! She was very kind and helped me figure out what treatment I wanted as it was my first time visiting a spa for a facial. I even purchased the aging serum and spf cream on my way out. I enjoyed their choice of 3 saunas, their rainfall showers and it was very hard to stay awake in the relaxation room

Okay and a good range of gym equipment but desperately needs a clean. The build up on the sink has to be more than a few weeks of not being cleaned, at least. Multiple other reviews comment on the cleanliness and reception staff attitude, so it seems management don't want to address any issues that the business has. Hopefully with the upcoming refurb, they'll want to look after the place.

I came here to attend an event organised by FightZumi and I had a wonderful time, venue was properly organised even among the Chaos but it would be appreciated if Queen Mother sport centre have an on-site car park for these events (there are no parking but very limited spot) but it’s in central London when car park is unnecessary when there are tube stations nearby and many bus stops.

Great big thank you the team at the centre, in particular the manager (whos name I've forgotten, sorry).
We requested at very short notice to hire the fitness studio for a last minute rehearsal. The manager was very nice to deal with, and went the extra mile to accomodate our requests. Even allowed us to use the bigger gym space when we realised our numbers were so many that the studio space was too small. Fantastic experience. Thank you again

The toilets are filthy, urine splatter everywhere. The hand dryers have layers upon layers of dust on the top. Doors and door handles are smeared with dirty handprints. In every corner, dust is thick and old.
The showers are horrible, they are designed for adults but that means the children that take classes cannot use them without adult help, but adults cannot help children without getting soaked. Not enough showers packed tight in a small, unpleasant cubicle.
If i could have given 0 stars,  i surely would have.

Good swimming pool! Overcrowded a times but good working hours. Staff at the desk is very well trained, polite and professional. Prices are reasonable. No long term agreements which is great, easy to sign up, freeze or cancel

Never tried their gym, but pool is fine, do give it a go

Please note: this review is predominantly about the customer service at head office and the general running of Fitness First. While I can’t say anything particularly positive about the staff at the gyms, I also can’t say anything overtly negative.

Over the two years I was a member of Fitness First, I changed gyms three times. I started at the Tottenham Court Road gym and was genuinely impressed by the facilities and what it offered. However, this location closed, and although we were expected to pay the same membership fee at the new gym, there was a significant drop in standards. This was the Marylebone location, which I eventually left due to how poor it was, not enough facilities, unhelpful staff, and absolutely not worth the price being charged. The selling points of the cold plunge and sauna were irrelevant as the sauna was smaller than Tottenham Court Road and the cold plunge didnt work over the 3 months I was there.

I then moved to the Oxford Circus gym. While it is very small, there is a good community of regulars. That said, it gets extremely busy, and it’s often not an ideal environment to train in.

The biggest issue with Fitness First, however, is how the company is run. There is no genuine customer interaction, and there seems to be a large disconnect from what I think should be more than a bog-standard gym. Head office refuses to speak on the phone and can take up to a week to respond to emails. When challenged about being forced to move gyms, you’re simply told you’re tied into a contract and therefore can’t leave.

I recently decided that I was tired of paying a high price for the bare minimum, so I chose to leave. The repercussions of this decision have been a nightmare. I cancelled through the app and was told I had nothing left to pay. A few days later, I received an email stating my account was overdue. When I called the Oxford Circus gym (the only location you can actually phone), I was met with a sarcastic response: “You should know you can’t just cancel your direct debit.” This is not what I did, nor what I would ever do.

This situation ultimately resulted in complete silence from head office once they became involved, and I was left having to pay regardless of the circumstances.

I would not recommend Fitness First if you’re looking to elevate your fitness experience beyond that of a cheap commercial gym. Fitness First is exactly that — a cheap commercial gym, just with a much higher monthly cost.

I do not recommend.

Pearl at Fitness First is really helpful and always makes things easier to understand. Always welcoming, gives good advice, and makes training feel more comfortable. A big reason why coming to the gym feels like a good experience.

I have been to the fitness first Oxford Circus gym quite few times as a day pass and all I can say I had the most amazing time, clean environment , positive staff that I have ever been in London. The best gym ever. I can’t thank enough Irma the manager how supported she was in one of my training days to welcome me with positiveness at the gym and all the staff they were always there to answer any questions I had about the new “able machines”. One of the things I like at this gym is that always is tight, clean and safe to access to anything. Made my workouts so enjoyable ❤️ Thank you so much Team of  Fitness First Oxford Circus 🌷 See you at my next training session 💪🏼

Love this gym - Irma the manager has always been lovely and friendly. The morning crowd are also chatty and friendly and it's not busy- I don't do evenings so can't speak for then. I've actually chatted with Pearl when she trains in other gyms - although haven't seen her in here for a while, lovely woman. I hate leaving reviews unless really annoyed (which skews the fairness of these things admittedly) so am balancing out some of the weird hate on here with my positive experience of this gym!

Not sure why so many hate filled reviews on here recently - from suspiciously one time reviewers 👀🕵🏽‍♂️ but I love the morning team so wanted to give them some love back!

This has been my home club since 2010. It’s always been a really comfortable place to come to work out. Some reviews and comments reference the club being small but as a centrally located gym I would argue that to be misleading. Yes it is small compared to the non-city centre warehouse style gyms but this is zone 1 in London and it definitely stands in line with most other local gyms. It has a great size gym floor stocked with continually renewed machines, a sprung floor studio plus spin studio. The changing rooms have newly installed saunas (yes they are small but they are proportionate) which is great after a session. The current management team are genuinely awesome. Irma is beautiful soul who always greets me with a wide smile pure warmth…I literally have no complaints.

I’ve been training at Nuffield for several months now, and I can honestly say it’s one of the best gym experiences I’ve had. The facilities are always spotless, the equipment is top-notch, and there’s a really welcoming atmosphere from both the staff and members.

A special mention has to go to Mark, one of the personal trainers—he’s absolutely fantastic. Not only is he incredibly knowledgeable and professional, but he’s also genuinely supportive and motivating. Mark takes the time to understand your individual goals and tailors each session to push you in the right direction without ever feeling overwhelming. His energy, attention to form, and positive attitude make every workout something to look forward to.

If you're looking for expert guidance, especially from someone who truly cares about your progress, I can’t recommend Mark highly enough. Five stars all round!

This gym has so much potential, it's just a shame that Nuffield Health fail to actually invest in it

- Pool constantly out of action
- Gym is run down
- Mens locker rooms are a disgrace with 60% of lockers fit for use and easily 40% out of action - this has been raised for TWO years now but little has been done
- Mens shower area is simply disgusting
- constant hot water issues

Doesn't seem to matter if you email the branch or their HQ, nothing is done about it.

Not as if the gym has cheap membership either

Would be great for Virgin Gyms or the like to buy/take over the lease as the location is fantastic.

Most staff are very pleasant too
Ive been coming to Bloomsbury for over a year now and the staff are amazing. Especially the reception staff.. always friendly and happy to help! Shout out to Kelly and Elle!

I really enjoy coming to this gym. The reception staff are always welcoming and friendly. I especially appreciate being greeted with a smile from Isabel every time I arrive or the energy and great attitude of Alejandro and Chris… it’s a lovely way to start a workout.

The gym itself is spacious, well-equipped with high-quality machines, and has the added bonus of a swimming pool, sauna and steam room.

However, the cleanliness of the steam room and the entrance area of it, often leaves much to be desired, as water tends to remain stagnant.

On a couple of occasions, I have asked a trainer to explain how to use a particular machine correctly, but I was ignored, which left me feeling as though help is reserved only for those paying for personal training sessions. For this reason, I prefer not to ask again.

Aside from these points, I really do like this gym and appreciate what it offers.

I am writing to formally raise serious concerns regarding the overall standards at this branch, which, in my experience, are significantly below those of other branches.

Firstly, the level of customer service is extremely poor. Staff members appear to lack the necessary skills, training, and professionalism required to handle customer enquiries or complaints effectively. Concerns raised are not addressed constructively, and there is a general absence of accountability.

In particular, the branch manager (a European female) has repeatedly dismissed legitimate concerns regarding facilities. Rather than attempting to resolve issues, her standard response has been that customers are free to cancel their subscriptions. This approach is unprofessional and demonstrates a disregard for customer satisfaction and brand reputation.

Additionally, the condition and availability of facilities are unacceptable:
•	The swimming pool and steam room have been closed for over ten days.
•	The men’s underwear dryer has been out of service for approximately two months.
•	Only two men’s showers are functioning correctly; the remaining showers are either broken or do not provide consistent hot or cold water.
•	The disabled shower has been continuously dripping water, indicating a lack of maintenance.

There are also ongoing concerns regarding staff conduct. The branch has gained a negative reputation among members, with reports that male staff members spend excessive time socialising with female customers. Allegations include inappropriate behaviour, including forming personal relationships and engaging in intimate conduct while on duty and in uniform. Such behaviour is wholly unacceptable and damages the professionalism and integrity of the brand.

Despite the declining quality of service and facilities, the branch has recently increased its monthly membership fees. This is extremely disappointing and unjustifiable given the current conditions.

It is also concerning that the branch manager appears to operate as though she has full ownership authority, rather than representing the company’s values and policies. This has resulted in a dismissive culture where customer concerns are not taken seriously.

I strongly urge regional management or ownership to intervene, review staffing and management practices at this branch, and address the ongoing facilities issues. Immediate attention is required to protect the brand’s reputation and ensure members receive the level of service they are paying for.

I hope this matter will be reviewed promptly and taken seriously.

I had a lovely experience at Aveda Covent Garden. It’s a hijab friendly salon where privacy is well respected, which made me feel completely comfortable throughout my visit. The stylists were friendly, professional, and made me feel very welcome.

I had the BEST experience at Aveda Covent Garden. I had the wonderful Katie for my colour and the beautiful Daise for my silk press and styling. As a curly-haired girl I always get nervous trusting my curls, but with them I felt leaving so confident and happy. Can’t wait to be back!♥️

I felt so well taken care of by the Aveda team. Pooja was excellent doing my balayage; she demonstrated confidence and professionalism. This was my first time modeling and also my first balayage experience, and it was smooth and the final color is gorgeous!! Tabi washed and massaged my scalp, making me relax, and Christina styled my hair very well. Throughout, Pooja was guided by Victoria as her instructor, who carefully monitored everything and was super professional and lovely too.  Everyone was very kind and professional, also the receptionist during check in and check out. It’s was an absolute amazing experience. Thank you, guys!

I had a great experience at the Aveda Covent Garden branch thanks to Annie 😃. She helped me choose the perfect moisturising lotion for my face and was incredibly informative, friendly, and approachable throughout. Her knowledge was impressive, especially when explaining the latest products in the Advanced Botanical Kinetics range. I really appreciated how confident and thoughtful her recommendations were — highly recommend asking for Annie if you visit!

This was my first experience with Aveda and it was great. My stylist and therapist were Ayshe and Melissa who were amazing and very attentive. I requested the private area which was closed off with a curtain to offer full privacy. The salon was tidy and all the staff were friendly and welcoming. Even the service of checking in and out was great. Enjoyed my experience and definitely will be going again for haircuts ☺️

LEYA - A Truly Exceptional Pilates Instructor

Leya is, without question, one of the most outstanding Pilates instructors I’ve ever worked with. Her sessions strike that rare balance of being calming, challenging, and completely engaging from start to finish. She brings a passion to her teaching that you can feel the moment you walk into the room.

What sets Leya apart is her incredible attention to detail. Her hands‑on corrections are thoughtful, precise, and always delivered with such a soft, reassuring voice that you instantly feel supported rather than self‑conscious. She has a gift for helping you understand your body better, guiding you into proper alignment in a way that feels empowering and safe.

Her classes are genuinely welcoming for everyone whether you’re a complete beginner or someone with years of experience. Leya offers clear, accessible options for every level, making sure each person can work at a pace that feels right for them while still progressing. You never feel out of place; you feel encouraged, seen, and capable.

Every lesson with Leya leaves you stronger, more grounded, and genuinely excited to come back. She’s a rare find, and I couldn’t recommend her more highly.
Was here traveling for the week for work. Sick gym really clean modern and cool atmosphere. Staff was friendly and good price for a week pass.

This is by far the best Fitness First in London. I’ve visited several different locations, and London Bridge stands out every single time. I feel confident using the machines here — everything is well laid out, there’s plenty of space for everyone to work out comfortably, and it never feels overcrowded.

The sauna and steam room are always hot and ready, which makes the post-workout experience perfect. The staff are genuinely friendly, welcoming, and always ready to help with anything you need. The whole gym is well maintained, clean, and consistently looked after.

Really nice gym with several dedicated areas depending on your workout focus — whether it’s strength training, cardio, or functional fitness. The equipment is top-notch and well maintained. The staff are super friendly and helpful, which makes the atmosphere even better.

The spa area could be improved a bit — it would be great if it were unisex and if the sauna were a bit larger. Other than that, it’s a great place to train.

I also love that they offer day passes — perfect for people visiting London from time to time. I’ll definitely be coming back again! 💪

Loved my Reformer Pilates sessions with Leya!! She is kind, and so attentive. She gives thoughtful modifications based on your level and offers hands-on corrections, which helps me improve every class. The space feels challenging (in a good way) and very supportive 🌿🫧

Hi came to the Fitness first Gym Baker street branch today met Mr Abdullah brother looking forward to join the Fitness first Gym Baker Street branch lovely guy it was very nice to meet brother Abdullah and i joined the Gym because of his motivation and the gym it self as well. The cleanliness of the gym was the main thing i was looking for at my home gym to join. Once again thank you so much  Abdullah for your tour and well professional behaviour💝🥳

My husband and I joined the club a week ago. One thing we noticed is that the trainers here are true professionals who clearly love what they do. It really motivates us to come to the club more often.
We truly appreciate that Thomas stayed after the boxing class to work on our technique individually for about half an hour when he found out it was our first time. Matt also helped me set up my weightlifting technique and conducted a strength and flexibility test.
Thank you!

My experience with this company has been disappointing from day one. I was overcharged at the start of my membership, the Baker Street gym often had no hot water, and when I raised this, a staff member told me it was “not their fault” because management had emailed members. Towels regularly had an unpleasant smell.

The issues became worse when I tried to cancel. From 27 October onward, I emailed several times requesting cancellation, yet my messages were ignored. When they eventually replied, the responsibility was shifted back onto me — first claiming I had emailed the “generic” address, then explaining that Chelsi could not respond because she was off. No one acknowledged the clear communication failures on their side.

I also reported that my app did not show the cancellation option. They were aware of this problem but did nothing to resolve it, leaving me unable to cancel through the required process. Despite that, I was still charged for an additional month, even though my login was inactive.

A simple cancellation request turned into 6 weeks of unanswered emails, conflicting explanations and misplaced blame. The lack of accountability and consistency, combined with earlier service issues, shows very poor customer care.I can’t say all Fitness First gyms are the same, but I would certainly avoid the Baker Street location at all costs.

Good gym overall, but what's going on with the machines? So many cable machines, yet only one Smith machine and no seated low row. We definitely need more Smith machines and a proper low row. Please invest in the equipment members actually need.

I visited this club yesterday and had a great experience, but my visit today at 3:30 PM was a complete contrast due to the front desk staff’s conduct.
As soon as I scanned my code, I was met with a blunt, "You aren’t allowed to be here." There was no greeting or professional courtesy; the delivery was incredibly rude and dismissive. While it was eventually explained that my membership required a £10 supplement fees which I had no issue paying—the hostile way I was spoken to was unnecessary.
Working in a customer-facing role requires a level of kindness and a welcoming attitude. The staff member’s behavior was so unpleasant that it completely ruined my mood for training. I hope management addresses this, as no member should have their gym session soured before it even begins.

The Locker Room has long been a popular spot in South London, known for its friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere. The team here are welcoming and not as strict as at some other venues, which helps create a comfortable and easy-going environment for visitors.

It used to have more appeal back when it was known as the onkly Sauna with aheated and comfortable smoking area — a feature that many regulars miss since it closed. Another big change is the hours: once famous for being open 24 hours on weekends, the venue now closes at 11 p.m., which has reduced its late-night appeal.

Visited Locker Room this afternoon...I don't know what happened-previously staff was always quite polite. Today I got LOTS of ATTITUDE from Italian gentleman who was manning the entry point  Later, his counterpart wasn't particularly welcoming either. Guys, you need to learn how to be more welcoming, it is a social place! Or else, you'll loose all your customers.

I’ve been coming here for about 2–3 years, and almost every visit has involved some kind of hostility or unnecessary issue! From the same two members of staff. I always come in with a smile, I’m polite, I don’t take drugs or cause trouble, yet somehow, it always seems to be people of colour who get targeted.It’s honestly disappointing that this kind of behaviour still happens. Tonight, I was watched and followed around the sauna. I’ve spoken to several other customers (coincidentally, none of them white) who’ve shared similar experiences of being treated differently. I’m not someone who seeks conflict, but it was clear this staff member was looking to provoke a reaction. I chose not to engage, but the bias and hostility were undeniable.Of course, those who haven’t experienced this kind of treatment will be quick to defend the staff. But sometimes, it’s important to look beyond your own experiences and recognise that not everyone is treated the same. Don’t claim to support inclusivity while singling people out because of their differences. These two are the ones to be careful of

First time visiter on a Saturday the guy on reception had the attitude didn't wanna be there just took my money, no welcome just took my money and gave me my towel, not a good start

The is small louge area as you walk in, when means you walk through this to the lockers you see the guys sitting there in there towels, this felt weird and didn't work no other sauna I've been to is like this, you walking through with outside shoes on that are dirty and guys walking barefoot is not good

The is medium rest room on ground floor with three rest cubicals and 4/5 round the corner on the way to the sauna, down stairs is showers, steam room and some more cubicals and some more semi dark small rooms, all the cubicals the is only room to stand none you can lie down

By the showers down stairs the is plastics grills on the floor stop you slipping but these all had soaking wet towels underneath, the whole of basement smelled damp and unwelcoming, it's very tight and cramped that two people can't walk past each other with out one of you stopping to let the other one pass

The is no hot tub here

£20 is expensive for the facility's available considering sweatbox is £24

After my experience with the guy reception, the outdated smelly unclean facilities I won't be going back

The website states "Operating in the heart of Kennington with a fresh from a comprehensive refit" is what you call  a comprehensive refit you are really taking the mick, this place has no money spent on it for years

I have been to various saunas in European cities like Barcelona, Valencia, Budapest, Amsterdam, Milano Athens etc. This was by far the most dirty and the most repulsive facilitie i have ever seen since now.
The facilities inside are so bad maintaned and almost all the spaces smell incredibly bad. It is also very small with tight spaces and only two floors. If you want sleepers you need to pay 4£ for the pair, they do not provide for free.
Also if you are not interested to men under 40 or 50 this place is not for you for sure. Almost 70 - 80% of the customers there are over 60 years of age and they do not respect you, they touch without your consent. Overalll it was a terrible experience. Please avoid this place for your own good at all costs especially if you are under 30 and don't like a specific age group over 40 - 50 years old.
I left the place after 10 - 15m. even though i had paid for the entrance and for the slippers.
Dentist and assistant were really kind and made the whole experience super safe and calming. Explained findings in great detail giving me a good understanding of my dental situation. Would recommend.

Dr Ani has been amazing, I came to her in a lot of pain after my dentist wasn't able to complete the root canal treatment I needed within a reasonable time frame (they couldn't give me an appointment for over 3 weeks!).  She was able to see me within a day of my initial call and provided a temporary fix so that I was no longer in pain until she could schedule a longer appointment in order to complete the work which was completed today.  Throughout the experience she has been a pleasure to deal with and extremely professional and knowledgeable I felt completed relaxed and at ease in her care.  I would also like to thank the receptionist who was extremely kind and accommodating when I initially called virtually in tears with the pain I was experiencing.  I would highly recommend this dental surgery to anyone.

Been going to City Dental since 2018, have always had a great experience with all the dentists being professional & patient. I’m sure I could pay less for treatment elsewhere, but in my eyes you get what you pay for, my teeth have never been in a better condition, I no longer avoid the dentist because of the service I receive with every visit I no longer have dread or fear when attending appointments.

I would like to thank Dr Maria for a very excellent service and patient care. I have a bad experience with my previous dentist and i was left with so much pain as they could not extract my tooth. I came here today and Dr Maria extracted it with no problem. Thank you very much Dr Maria for getting me out of this scary pain i have had for a week, i am so grateful. I will of course highly recommends this dental practice.
Ani is a gem. Very polite and knowledgeable. Had a great and smooth hygiene appointment with her. Will 100% be back.

Excellent gym with wonderful trainers, receptionists, and housekeepers!

I recently joined Third Space Marylebone this month, and I have already been fully impressed with the gym facilities and members.

My personal trainer, Charbel, is very professional and highly knowledgeable in fitness training. I train with him as a PT every day, and I already feel a significant improvement in my performance this month.

Other members of the gym are hardworking and conscientious. In particular, Marcos (the housekeeper) always works very hard; he is essentially everywhere, sorting out everyone's needs.

I like the personal locker and laundry service, as I do not have to bring any of my used gym clothes home; everything is clean and ready for me to train in the morning.

I am so happy I joined Third Space Marylebone—I should have joined much earlier!

Had the chance to workout at Third Space Marylbone during my stay in London last June. Fantastic gym, super friendly people at the reception. You could feel the professionalism and good vibe of the personal trainers.
Last but not least the pool and sauna after the workout made my day.

I can’t recommend Third Space Marylebone highly enough! This urban sanctuary is a five-star oasis for fitness enthusiasts. From the moment you step in, you're greeted by cutting-edge gym facilities, including an expansive functional training space and a dedicated Wattbike area that truly sets it apart. The range of group training classes is impressive, ensuring there's something for everyone, whether you're a beginner or a seasoned pro.

Post-workout, the 16m pool is a dream, providing the perfect setting to unwind. The sauna and steam room add an extra layer of luxury, helping you melt away any stress. The vibrant yet relaxing atmosphere makes it easy to focus on your fitness goals while feeling pampered.

The staff is not only friendly but incredibly knowledgeable, always eager to help you make the most of your experience. Third Space Marylebone has redefined my fitness journey, and I wholeheartedly give it five shining stars! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Great variety of classes and super friendly staff. I love coming to this location because it feels more cozy and quiet. Facilities are also top notch with a nice sauna in the girls’ fitting room, and a super hot steam in the pool area. One of my favorite locations :)

Have been a member of Third Space at Marylebone for nearly 2 years and regularly attend yoga, cycling and WOD classes, as well as swim at the Third Space Canary Wharf gym.  I really enjoy the Marylebone gym - the instructors really take an interest in improving your fitness/technique; the cleaning staff are ever present and do a wonderful job keeping the high quality facilities looking good; and the concierge staff greet you every day by name and are really lovely.  A special mention goes to Eleanor on the front desk who is always cheery (even at 6am) and goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome.  Thanks to all for making my daily workouts enjoyable.

This was my first visit to this gym and I had a great experience.  The gym was clean an spacious, the pool temperature was perfect, but best of all, the friendly welcome and assistance from Kieran was exceptional.  He really took the time to show me around and explain all of the equipment.  Brilliant! Very worthy of the 5 star rating!

I have been using the Covent Garden Nuffield for the past two months and absolutely love it. The gym has the latest newly installed equipment. The gym is clean and never overcrowded.
My training with trainer Natalia has been fantastic, she is a true professional with incredible knowledge of the human body and the joints. She has tailored my sessions perfectly to fit around what I can and can’t do.
I’m completely addicted to the yoga classes every Tuesday and Friday evening.
As someone who’s a big fan of saunas and steam rooms, it did take me a little while to get used to the unisex facilities, but now I really appreciate them as part of the overall experience.

I recently had my introductory visit to the gym and had a really positive experience.
Tia was very clear in explaining everything, friendly and happy to answer all my questions.
The facility itself is well equipped and has what I was looking for in a gym. Overall, it left a great impression and I’d definitely recommend it to anyone considering joining.

I had the pleasure to train with Natalia Suprunenko at this gym and I can’t recommend her enough as a personal trainer. She really helped me understand how to train properly and guided me toward the right exercises for my body and goals, which made a huge difference. She is extremely knowledgeable, professional, and kind, and always takes the time to explain things clearly. Thanks to her support, my time at the gym has become much more effective, and I’ve seen real improvements in both strength and overall wellbeing. Definitely a 5 start personal trainer

Nuffield Covent garden is a fantastic gym in a great location. The gym is equipped with latest machines and very well maintained. Staff is lovely and super friendly. Also offers great evening classes. Really enjoy coming here for a workout.

I was on holiday staying at the Resident across the street so this gym was very convenient. A super nice woman named June was working the front desk and she was very helpful getting me checked in. The gym was clean and the locker room was very nice and clean as well. I bought a day pass as I was traveling the next day. The cost was shocking! £25 for a single day pass! I pay this much at home for a month! I bit the bullet and paid it as I was commited due the the proximity of my hotel and lack of time to look for another gym. The gym was well furnished (machines, free weights, mats, etc) and the equipment was newer and in good shape. I worked out for 70 minutes and although it was a busy time (6:00pm), I was able to mostly get the equipment i needed when I wanted it. Plenty of benches and free weights available but machines quite busy. In addition to the cost, I wasn't pleased with the volume of the music. I could clearing hear the music from the ceiling mounted speakers the whole time even though I had earbuds in and my volume turned up high. Overall not a great experience.

This is a great gym! It’s well equipped, always clean and the staff are very kind and helpful, Irvine is always great. I also love that it has a female sauna in the shower areas, which makes this relaxing moment very comfortable. Special thanks to Talia, the best personal trainer ever!

Great gym in London with very reasonable prices. The equipment is high quality and there’s a good variety for all types of workouts. The place is clean and has a friendly atmosphere.
Special thanks to the trainer August for his kind, professional, and fun attitude, always helpful and motivating. Highly recommended!

Recently started going to Fitness First and honestly… no notes! Best gym I’ve been to by far. Machines are always spotless, bathrooms and sauna are actually clean, and the staff is ridiculously friendly, special shoutout to August for making every visit better.
10/10 would sweat again 💪🏻

Amazing gym in central London, clean , new equipment, and spacious which was unexpected for central London .
August the manager there is your guy!💪🏻
Made my day!

Popped in here as I was in the area and was so surprised by how good it was! The weights area is so big and the plates were well organised! (Pet peeve that you can never find any plates/ they are a mess on the tree) it was so clean too, I couldn’t see any mess or dust in any corners. The changing rooms were lovely too! So Spacious and in hood condition. Also the staff were all so nice! Especially one called Gene, he was really helpful while I was there too. Give him a raise! Will be coming again 😁

I’ve been a member at Fitness First for just over a year now, and I can honestly say it’s been such a positive experience. The atmosphere is always welcoming, and the whole team is super friendly and supportive. No matter what level you’re at, there’s always someone ready to help, guide, or encourage you.

A special mention goes to Ty — he’s absolutely amazing! He’s not only knowledgeable and professional, but also incredibly approachable and friendly. He always takes the time to check in, motivate, and make sure I’m on track, which makes such a big difference.

Overall, Fitness First has become more than just a gym for me — it feels like a supportive community where I’m always pushed to do my best. I can’t recommend it enough!

I’ve been training here consistently and recently swapped from Highbury to make this my home gym - I LOVE the atmosphere. The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. Alexis always greets me with the sweetest smile at reception, and Ty has been an exceptional trainer during my sessions. He’s super attentive, supportive, and genuinely cares about client progress.

Also, a big thank you to the General Manager who kindly offered me a protein shake - small touches like that make the environment feel like a real community or second home.

One thing I really appreciate is that management takes feedback seriously. I raised a couple of small points previously, and they were addressed efficiently - that kind of responsiveness goes a long way!

Some (new) suggestions for improvement:
•	A StairMaster would be a great addition, perhaps replacing one of the treadmills.
•	A hip abduction machine would also be amazing if possible.
•	A filtered water station that offers cold still and sparkling water instead of the current tap fountain.
•	A mirror behind or in front of the cable machines would help with form correction during workouts.

Other than that, everything is excellent - including the overall cleanliness and hygiene of both the gym floor and women’s changing rooms. The cleaner works extremely hard, and it’s always spotless whenever I’m in there. I also love the women’s-only sauna near the showers, the great class options, and the overall vibe. Excellent location too - situated inside the station so very easy to catch train right after.

Very happy with my new home gym!

Great London city gym and the facilities are 10/10. I’ve been working with Gene for the last 2 years and he is such a joy to work with, he’s been training me recently and his service is impeccable and such a great trainer. Amber’s boxing class during lunchtimes are the best for a quick boost of energy and she makes sure that we are looked after before, during and after the class. Tyrese is also another fabulous trainer who has been one incredible man he’s really helped me and my colleagues get in the best shape and he’s really attentive and always helpful around the clock.

Very disappointed with how Fitness First handled my situation. After being injured and unable to train, my membership fell into arrears and was passed directly to a debt collection company. Despite explaining my circumstances and trying to resolve the issue, I was repeatedly told that Fitness First could not help and that everything must go through DebtCo, including cancellation.

There was no flexibility, no face-to-face support, and no real effort to resolve the issue as a loyal member. The experience felt impersonal and stressful, especially during a difficult time financially and medically. I expected much better customer care.

I joined this gym based on the volume of positive reviews, but in reality it has been a major disappointment and represents extremely poor value for money, particularly at ~£109 per month.

The facilities are in a poor state. The gym feels persistently damp, and much of the equipment shows visible rust and wear. The range of equipment is also limited compared to other gyms at this price point, making it difficult to train properly without compromise.

The most serious issue is the changing facilities. The male changing rooms are currently closed for renovation. They were sub-standard before, and the temporary solution is frankly unacceptable. Members are told to change in a tiny room in the corner of the gym, which realistically fits no more than three people. On my last visit, we were crammed into this space, no room to move, no privacy, and very limited secure storage. There are only a handful of lockers available. It completely undermines the service being paid for. Despite this, members are still being charged full price.

The two-month cancellation notice period is not clearly highlighted during sign-up. It may be in the small print, but it is certainly not obvious, which only adds to the sense of poor transparency.

Overall, this is one of the worst gym facilities I have used relative to cost. Unless there is a significant improvement or acknowledgement of the reduced service currently being offered, I cannot recommend this gym to anyone.

A Hidden Gem to the max! Such amazing vibes here. Tranquil, clean, and quiet (almost unheard of in Central London). The gym has more than everything I need, the machines are top tier and still look/feel brand new. The spa facilities are also such a treat after a workout.

I am in two minds - are the facilities or the staff the best part of the Circle Gym and Spa? I can’t decide! The staff are warm, professional, and always go the extra mile. A special shoutout to Lisa for being so lovely every single time!

Very fairly priced for the service and facilities provided, and absolutely deserves 5 stars. For me, it’s hands down one of the best wellness spots in London. HIGHLY recommended.

(Photo of the private area in the rain attached - it's even more beautiful in the sun!)

An amazing gym and spa! I have been a member at the gym for the last 5 months now and love the place. Gym area is never too busy and can always get on what you want. The spa area is perfect to unwind and chill out after a workout. The classes are Brilliant. Boxing with Michael on a Monday and Wednesday is a must! The staff are always warm welcoming.. special shoutout to Lisa who is always great!

Highly recommend!

Cannot speak highly enough of this place. A real sanctuary hidden amongst the crazy hustle and bustle of London.

The gym setup and equipment quality is great, split across multiple rooms so even when it’s crowded, it doesn’t feel like everyone is crawling over each other.

But it’s the spa, sauna and pool that set this gym apart from any I’ve been to. Recovery has never been more satisfying or relaxing. Coupled with great staff, this place is a real gem. Top tier.

Been a member of The Circle Gym Club for fourmonths now, and every visit makes me feel welcomed, supported, and motivated. I’m there 2-3 times a week! My coach is amazing - love him! He is constantly helping me keep up my training, even with a shoulder injury. The place is just amazing and the SPA is beyond relaxing.

Had the most wonderful massage at Massaggi. Ben was very professional and clearly an expert. He did a quick physiological assessment on my posture and alignment which I found insightful. He also gave some assessment on my back muscles which relate to the sports that I play. The massage released a lot of the tension I had, I’d asked him to focus on my back. It felt so much better after and I have already booked my next session. Highly recommend!

Been going to see Ben for a few months now. Being an active person focussed on strength training and cardio, I regularly feel strain and tightness in my muscles that no amount of stretching or massage guns can resolve. Bens knowledge of the body and his sports massage gives my muscles the duly needed recovery , ready to perform and peak again.

I had an excellent experience, Ben helped me tremendously with shoulder pain and recurring headaches, and the knots were fully cleared after each session. He’s skilled, attentive, and clearly knows how to target problem areas, and I always left feeling relaxed and pain-free. Highly recommend.

I had an excellent experience at Massaggi. Ben was incredibly knowledgeable and attentive — he quickly identified the source of my shoulder pain and worked on it with precision and care. I left feeling noticeably lighter and with much better mobility. Highly recommend Ben for anyone dealing with muscle tension or shoulder issues!
I’ve been to 4–5 sessions at Massaggi and it’s been great every time. Ben has helped loads with my upper back and shoulder tightness — always feel much better afterwards. Highly recommend.

I’d like to thank the team for going above and beyond to deliver immaculate service and for always making me feel welcome. The trainers are absolute superstars, and I’d also like to acknowledge how hard‑working the cleaning crew is. The gym is always spotless, and the equipment is kept tidy and clean.  It truly makes a difference. The reception team is warm and helpful, and any issues I’ve had have been resolved without fuss. I’m very much looking forward to another year with this gym.

Nothing wrong to say about this place. Kel, general manager is super welcoming and helpful, same goes for each other staff member I encountered. Amazing sauna and showers, pretty rare for London gyms.
What a great gym, medium size, but all the equipment you need to get into shape. The team are also very friendly, Veronika, Jonathan and Bradley. Thanks for the good workouts!!

I came here from the US and found Fitness First as my place to workout and these guys are great! Veronica, Bradley and Jonathan were awesome! If you want a really great facility, with great people to work out at, Fitness First is the place!

Thanks gang!! See ya next year!!
Love this gym, doesn’t get too busy in the morning or lunch. Also, Veronika is a Harox slayer, thanks for a super engaging class :)

Excellent. I’ve been to multiple Walk-in Backrub locations dozens of times in the past few years. The one in Neal’s Yard is slightly smaller (as befits the area), but on the weekends seems to have at least 3 people giving massages so the wait hasn’t been bad.

They operate as the name suggests - walk in and you can get a chair back massage in 10 minute increments - no appointment needed (or taken). They clean between each person, were wearing face masks, and have a clear timer on the wall for each person so easy to see what time elapsed.

Tip: Make sure you get their paper rewards card as you buy 9 massages and get the 10th free.

Very good tailored massage from Clive.  He was keen to make sure the pressure was okay on different parts of the spine and shoulders. Came out feeling so much better.  Didn't have to wait. Paid £28 for 20 mins which felt like good value. Will definitely go back.
Man this is place is great. Good prices, excellent backrub. No hassle with booking. Been here at least a dozen times

Absolutely delighted to find this place🙏
I squeeze a visit into my lunch hour and the massage is so good I can’t wait to go back!
Been twice, not had to wait either time. Clive is able to give a good amount of pressure that really releases my neck and shoulder tightness.
The atmosphere is also relaxing, even though you’re not lying down.

I didn't have to wait long and my masseuse, (male) was polite and knew what he was doing.  I'm glad I got him as I noticed a female member of staff looking very stressed and like she didn;t want to be there as she was working on a client.  It would have been nice if they closed the door, yes it was warm but outside was loud.  Aircon and some music in the background would have been nicer.  Also I would have liked to have been offered something to put my hair up as I didn't have anything at the time.  Good value for money though.

I’ve been training with Sameer at Nuffield Health Paddington for weight loss and honestly couldn’t recommend him enough!!! From day one, he took the time to really understand my goals, limitations, and lifestyle, which made everything feel genuinely tailored to me rather than generic. He’s incredibly caring and approachable, and he always makes you feel comfortable and supported, no matter your starting point.
